Reviews.Title: “Great little place”
Reviews.Author: Othermonkey
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with friends after a cruise, loved the location, just a short walk from all the action but away from the constant noise of Bourbon Street. Rooms are set around a central courtyard and the doors open direct to the seating area or the pool, so if people are having an early breakfast and/or a cigar, you will hear them chatting and smell the cigar smoke, pool area room is quieter. Wifi works well but the standalone PC is very slow and needs help. Staff here are wonderful and very helpful, it was the 2nd hotel we had stayed at and for the price and location would be the one I would go back to, it's a lovely building, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back”
Reviews.Author: NHvacationer61
Reviews.Content: Have been to NOLA for vacation for past five years, first hotel that made us want to go back. VERY friendly and helpful staff. We arrived early. They held our bags and called us when the room was ready, which was before their stated 3pm check in. Room was clean and spacious for a basic hotel room. Some rooms on first floor open onto courtyard or pool area, so people are right outside your room all day-the pool and courtyard areas are a nice place to unwind. We were on the second floor which was nice. We have found the place to stay when we return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, pretty good hotel”
Reviews.Author: november_moon
Reviews.Content: There were a lot of things I liked about this hotel, but some basic things that keep it from getting a good/excellent rating from me. First the good: The location is wonderful - in the Lower Quarter, so in the more residential, quiet side, and only a few blocks from Jackson Square, Frenchman St, etc. We loved being so close to everything and having the option to pop back into the hotel any time we wanted. The hotel is very charming, has a great courtyard, and nice pools. I loved swimming in the afternoon and relaxing in the courtyard after wandering around all day. The historic building is neat, really has the old New Orleans feel to it. The rooms are comfortably furnished, and our bed was one of the best hotel beds I've slept in. The staff is very nice. Everyone from the front desk, to the bellman, to the cleaning staff. Now for the not-so good: We had a room overlooking the courtyard, which was nice, however the only windows in these rooms are in the door, which people walk right past - so we had to keep the shutters closed for privacy, otherwise people can see right into your room. So no view of the courtyard while in the room or even any natural light. Nothing really can be done about this - it is a function of the layout of the hotel - if I stayed there again, I would request a room in a different location. Our room was the first as you come up the stairs, so everybody walked by our room. The housekeeping was so-so. They didn't vacuum, didn't dust, didn't clean in the corners of the bathroom, and were very stingy with towels and TP. We actually had to ask for more TP. We put the ONE extra roll in the holder and were not given another roll until we asked a couple days later. No hotel guest should ever have to ask for something as basic as TP. Breakfast was not good - coffee, tea, hard boiled eggs, and cheap (stale) pastries. I has a crossant, but it was so stale that I only ate a couple bites. Breakfast was included in the price of the room and we still skipped it the rest of our trip. I really wanted to give this hotel a better rating because there are things that I loved about it, but there are some things that they just need to work on. It has a lot of potential. It could be really great. I didn't even mind the peeling wall paper and paint since it is an old hotel in a humid place - I expect some of that. If the hotel increased the quality of the breakfast and did a better job with the cleaning, I could easily give this hotel 5* - I would rave about it and tell everybody I knew to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, but Historic!”
Reviews.Author: HelloSanDiego
Reviews.Content: We arrived for the NCAA Final four weekend with high expectations regarding New Orleans and our quite expensive hotel room. Upon arrival, we were greeted and promptly checked in and valet parked the car. Our experience, was downhill from there, the Hotel Provincial was a perfect location to the French Quarter, Jackson Sqare and the French Market. However, the room was a major disappoint considering we paid over $325 per night. The room was musty, "historic"; in addition the bathroom wood was rotting were the sink was located, the room amenities were that of a road side motel, not hotel. Outside of the fact of location, I would not recomment this property to anyone who is paying over $100.00.

Reviews.Title: “Small, cute hotel”
Reviews.Author: punkissodead
Reviews.Content: This hotel is set up like a motel in that the doors to the rooms are accessible from the outside, but the rooms surround a courtyard and pool area, so the room doors are not facing the street, which is nice. The location, toward the Esplanade end of Chartres street, was perfect. It was still close to everything, but a bit more quiet. It was a very quick walk to Jackson Sq, the French Market (and Cafe du Monde) as well as Frenchman St. Royal St is the next street over, and Bourbon is the next street after that. It is supposedly haunted but I didn't see any evidence of that. You will see ghost tours stopping in front of the hotel constantly, though! The room itself is pretty basic: no fridge, microwave or coffeemaker, but it's still nice and clean and charming. It has a complimentary breakfast from 8-10am with tea, coffee, juice as well as an assortment of baked goods, some fruit, yogurt and hard-boiled eggs. The bar has happy hour from 3-6pm. The staff is VERY friendly and helpful and recommended some good places for us to go, and also provided maps, etc. This hotel had a more personal feel than the last place we stayed in the French Quarter. No bells and whistles but an affordable, comfortable stay close to the action of the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Charming!”
Reviews.Author: and_beyondChicagoIL
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, close to all the action but on a quiet charming little side street. The building is old but well maintained and the room conditions good. The complimentary breakfast is quite good and service great. All the charms of French Quarter

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with an excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: yankeeluvr02
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 wanted to stay in the French Quarter in a non-chain hotel and this was the perfect choice for us. It has the cutest little courtyard with a swimming pool and a sitting area. There are several buildings that make up the hotel. We paid forty bucks to upgrade to a bigger room in the center of the courtyard. It came with two very comfortable beds, a couch that folds out (that wasn't so comfortable) and a bathroom. It was nice enough, but the courtyard made it for us. We grabbed a drink from the bar at the hotel and sat in the courtyard to just relax after a long day of walking the city. This hotel's location is excellent. One block one direction is Decatur which is where Cafe Du Monde is located, the french market, the parade, etc. It's all right there. One block the other direction is Royal and then Bourbon.Just a few short blocks to Jackson Square, the Riverfront, anything you want. All kinds of restaurants, bars, shopping are just steps from the hotel. We will definately stay here when we return to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Believe that it is haunted!”
Reviews.Author: aek429
Reviews.Content: Okay... this might depend on whether you believe or not, but... after staying here, I believe. The hotel is a very nice 3 or 3.5 star hotel. It is in the Quarter, but a couple of blocks away from Bourbon St. So, it is an easy walk to get to Bourbon St., but good enough to be a little quieter. We stayed in Building 5, which is the building that used to be a Civil War hospital. In the night, I woke up 3 times, and I rarely wake up. The first time, I swear there was a dark presence at the floor-to-ceiling windows. It was not malevolent, but I did wake up during the night, feeling that there was something else in the room. So, make of that what you will. :) Being from the 1800s, the ceilings are very high. The rooms are not that big, but do seem bigger for that. The decor was tasteful and nice, much like a hotel should be. It was not the 4 Seasons, but it was nicer than a drury inn and worth the price paid. We did not eat at the hotel, preferring to try some of the staples of the Quarter, but it was a good buy and good stay overall!

Reviews.Title: “Location almost worth the so-so room and very basic breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Jonagold4
Reviews.Content: Very personable, helpful front desk staff. Overburdened bell guy. Small dresser in room and antique chairs barely comfortable for sitting. Beds were okay. Odd bathroom. Quiet room off pool. Easy to get everywhere in FQ, though. Did not eat at pricey Irene's Restaurant adjacent.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, well appointed hotel in the French Quarter.”
Reviews.Author: jazzeruth
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a lovely surprise. It has the old charm of the French Quarter but a quiet elegance. The location is perfect for touring all the sights of New Orleans. There is also parking, a bar on site and a continental breakfast. I loved the pool and the courtyard. Rooms were well appointed with comfortable beds and bedding.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a lot of improvement.”
Reviews.Author: SFCard
Reviews.Content: The hotel is older which gives it charm. However, the rooms are not as clean as they should be. The carpet was dirty, old and the ceiling fan was covered with dust. The housekeeping staff was very stingy with the towels and shampoo. They also did not dust the room/furniture well. The furniture was cute but they really need to upgrade their beds. The vents need to be cleaned badly. The air quality in the room was worse than the outdoors. The Front Desk was not very efficient. For a New Yorker, they were too slow moving and when booking an excursion, one Front Desk rep said to could not answer any questions nor could he give me any suggestions. Shortly after, I went to ask another female Front Desk and was helpful and actually booked the Steamboat excursion for us. However, it turns out her calculations were wrong. We didn't find out until we were at the Will Call window. Overall, the hotel does not get favorable reviews from us. They really need to work harder on their customer service from their cleanliness to retraining their staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value for what it is”
Reviews.Author: mhunter29
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night with 3 friends at the tail end of my bachelorette party. The location is good - close enough to walk to the busy areas of the French Quarter, and the building itself is very pretty. We got off to a bad start because we arrived at 1:00 and were told that the room wouldn't be ready until 3, and we were not very impressed with the customer service and the way we were dealt with. The room itself was fine - the bathroom was cramped and the tub wasn't very clean, but it served its purpose. We did enjoy the hotel bar and the courtyard, and the beds were comfortable. Overall, the stay was fine, but no rave review here.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay for Mardi Gras!”
Reviews.Author: KGartner46
Reviews.Content: We made a "last-minute" decision to take our family to Mardi Gras this year (by last-minute I mean early January!), and this was one of the few hotels that still had availability for 6 people. It ended up being perfect for our needs. The hotel is located on the quiet end of the French Quarter, very close to the French Market and a short walk to Jackson Square. It was a perfect location for a family with kids ages 11-20. Even on Mardi Gras day, when there is NO place in the French Quarter that is not completely insane, the courtyard was quiet and serene. Our rooms were comfortable, although very simple, and more than adequate for our needs. We had one room with 2 double beds where I stayed with my 3 daughters, while the "boys" (my husband and 17-year old son) stayed in a king-bedded room. They weren't connecting (which would have been great), but were just one door away. The beds were nice, and we all slept well. The service was good, although not outstanding. It would have been helpful to get a general orientation to the services of the hotel, and to the surrounding area when we checked in (for instance, it took me a few days to figure out that they offered a complimentary continental breakfast each morning). Perhaps the service is more hands-on during a less busy time of year. Some tips: - While the beignets at Cafe du Monde are a must at least once during your trip, you can have wonderful pastries without a half-hour line around the corner from the hotel at Croissants d'Or (on Ursiline). It is outstanding! Good lunch options also. - We had a great last-minute dinner at Louisiana Pizza Kitchen about 3 blocks away. - If you are there for Mardi Gras, don't miss seeing Mardi Gras Indians at the Backstreet Cultural Museum. We got there around lunchtime and enjoyed some rice & beans and sodas, and Congo Nation showed up shortly afterwards. A truly awesome & authentic New Orleans experience. - If you are going with kids you can avoid the worst of the Mardi Gras craziness by staying off Bourbon & Decatur. You will see a few topless women, and lots of drunk people, but a lot of what happens is very family friendly. We enjoyed Zulu at the edge of Louis Armstrong Park, and it was like a big family picnic! The trip was lots of fun and the Provincial was a great place to enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect French Quarter Experience”
Reviews.Author: Douglas U
Reviews.Content: Do not waste your stay in the French Quarter on a Homogenized Hotel! Coming to the quarter and staying in a national branded hotel robs you of the opportunity to not only see, but to "live" the French Quarter. If you try to vacation here like you do at Disney, you are missing the whole point. Here you are visiting a living community where kids go to school and people live their lives. There are two ways to experience the French Quarter: as a tourist and as a resident. I lived in the Hotel Provincial almost continuously for 3 years...they have the most amazing staff of real N'awlins people you will ever meet, very knowledgeable in the ways and means of the quarter. Location is perfect, only a couple blocks from Crazy Bourbon Street, Toney Royal Street, Kitchy Decatur, Trendy Marigny, Shopping at the French Market, and everything else. Rooms are cozy and well-appointed, probalby among the cleanest in the French Quarter. Linens are exceptionally clean and crisp, and the showers are hot and strong. The pools and gardens make for wonderful little places to reflect and plan. Of all the places I travel, including my own home on the worlds finest beach, it is Hotel Provincial that always finds its way into my dreams

Reviews.Title: “Nice place w/ great location”
Reviews.Author: Sergio A
Reviews.Content: I ended up switching from one of the more expensive places to this and loved every minute of it. Like in a lot of reviews the bathrooms aren't exactly the greatest but the location at this price is. It's a close walk to all the hot spots even if you've had a few too many! The staff was very helpful and parking was an added plus. I'd def stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely garden Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wh62
Reviews.Content: It is a two-story building with a courtyard garden and two swimming pools, conveniently located just steps where is the action,

Reviews.Title: “French Quarter Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CTSkywriter
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 days at Hotel Provincial. The room (101) was clean. The mattress was terrible. Every time one of us moved it woke the other up. Room 101 was a deluxe room with a king bed that was on a courtyard. Unfortunately, we were also the first room that everyone went by after a night out on Bourbon St. It was noisy at night, especially when people sat in the courtyard talking and laughing loudly and smoking at all hours of the night. You could smell the smoke in the room from outside. Then you heard everyone else traipsing by the room to go to breakfast. Needless to say we didn't get much sleep. Their idea of "luxurious" bedding was a white quilt with 200 thread count sheets (yes I checked the label). If you stay here, ask for a room that is in the back so it is quieter. Staff were nice. Good location in the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Dubiebrown
Reviews.Content: Great room for a good price! Has that French Quarter feeling and a couple blocks from Burbon St. Would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great location, wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: eneiford
Reviews.Content: My husband had business in New Orleans. We normally stay at the Marriott chain, however, we decided to book an independent, historical, hotel. We were pleasantly surprised. We also read the trip advisor reviews before we booked our room. This is a great location, clean room, beautiful grounds, and very accommodating staff. Will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great find in a quiet corner”
Reviews.Author: Rakdanit
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on reviews of previous travelers. I was not disappointed. The Provincial is in the quiet end of the French Quarter, literally a few blocks from the river, trolley and the action. It isw a complex of 5 buildings. (We were in the main one facing the pool.) Our room had canopied beds and antique furniture. The bathroom was smallish but adequate. There is a flat screen tv and a ceiling fan, plus ac. My only bug about the room is that there really is n't sufficcient light to read by at night. The room comes with a complimentary continental breakfast. There is a 5 star restaurant (Stella) on the premesis. The hotel staff, from housekeeping, bell hop to desk clerks were outstanding in their southern hospitality. Any questions were cheerfully answered, directions given and even noise problems solved. The hotel is walking distance to Cafe DuMond, all of the fine dining establishments and Bourbon Street.

Reviews.Title: “unique experience”
Reviews.Author: plasticman1234
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Provincial at the beginning of Mardi Gras.. In its advertising it said it does not have an elevator. The Bell Staff carries your luggage up there for you. We were a few blocks from the Trolley which took you anywhere in New Orleans. The Staff was great and our room was very clean. The decor was everything we expected. Its in the French Quarter and we were comfortable with the price and the accommodations. Can not wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: sherri819
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at this hotel because the price was right and it was located within walking distance to a lot of things to do in the French Quarter. We wanted to stay someplace that reflected some of the history of the area. We were not disappointed. There are several buildings and we were put in building 5. Our room was comfortable and just what we needed. The bathroom was clean and had no problems. There was breakfast provided daily: Toast, bagels, fruit, coffee, juice. It wasn't elablorate but was definitely enough to get our day started. But, the best part of our stay was the staff. They were always very helpful while checking in/out, making a rental car reservations, and for recommendations and directions. We definitely felt that we got our money's worth for the price of our stay. I would stay there again if I travel to New Orleans in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, but Won't Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: roxanne9000
Reviews.Content: Yes, this place is cute. It's in a really good location. It's got a nice little courtyard and a couple of swimming pools. The room had fancy canopied beds and interesting antique art work. However, the bathroom was total rubbish. So small, you had to climb over the toilet to get the door closed. Moldy and dingy. It was like a 1950's motor court motel's bathroom. I consider this unacceptable in a hotel. Second to a clean, comfortable bed - I need a clean, comfortable bathroom. Especially at this price. Also, the staff was kinda friendly, but maybe a bit more on the abrupt side than really felt welcoming. The next time I visited New Orleans, I stayed somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Worn out”
Reviews.Author: karawebster
Reviews.Content: Staff very helpful. The rooms are very dated andtired Bathrooms are cramped and worn out!!! This place needs an extreme make over. Not worth the rates they are charging.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but a little pricey”
Reviews.Author: SueMpa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an amazing location - 2 blocks from the Mississippi, Jackson Square and Royal Street. It's right in the heart of the French Quarter and walking distance from museums. It is a little pricey, especially around holidays - I didn't think the room was worth $269 for New Year's. The beds in the room were nice but the bathroom was terrible - the shower alternated between freezing and scalding hot and the shower head was only 3 feet tall. If the bathroom was renovated the room would have been perfect. A little warning - if you are a light sleeper people can get loud in the courtyard area which is open until 11pm.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: poohmami
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, just a few (short) blocks to everything in the French Quarter. The room was nice and clean, comes with all the amenities too (e.g., wireless, iron, hairdryer, nice continental breakfast). Didn't get a chance to check out the pool because it was early January (although the weather was pretty good, for winter!). My only complaint that there wasn't any self-parking available, only valet parking for $24/day. Otherwise, I'd totally stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we wanted”
Reviews.Author: beachVa
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a perfect location and the staff was very accommodating. I felt safe, happy and very comfortable during my stay. Erika went over and beyond to be helpful. I would suggest this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Room with Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: JLMChicago
Reviews.Content: We traveled to New Orleans in October 2011, and the hotel was great. The room was quaint and clean, and the staff were so helpful and friendly. They recommended a couple of local places to eat, that were so wonderful. It was quiet for sleeping at night, and close enough to everything to walk around, or take the trolley to the street car. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: debk68
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel for one night before our cruise. We wanted to be in the french quarter. The location was within walking distance to Bourbon St, The Desk Clerks, where not very friendly and had little information. The Bellman, Terry, was excellent at giving us suggestions and directions. He even offered to store our luggage on our return to New Orleans (we had a late flight). The hotel was old, they are doing some remodeling. The light in our bathroom, blew a fuse and the bellman suggested we leave the light on, because he wasn't sure he could fix it again! The courtyard was charming, the pool looked nice. The breakfast was basic continental, nothing special. The bar was empty on a Saturday night. Overall I thought it was a clean charming motel (no indoor hallways or elevator?) if you want to get away from the "chains" and sleep in charming comfort this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Okay - not for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: Meli299
Reviews.Content: Is it possible to find a hotel with both charm and function? The search continues. I stayed at the Provincial for three nights in December 2011 while attending a conference. As it was my first trip to NOLA, I wanted to stay somewhere charming and historic in the French Quarter, instead of the generic conference hotels. The first room that I was assigned, in Building 5, absolutely reeked of cigarette smoke (that kind of smell that has been building up for decades and can't be removed unless you change the wallpaper and carpets), despite the fact that all rooms are supposedly smoke-free. The fact that the window in that room was sealed shut didn't help. Luckily, the hotel was able to re-assign me. My second room, in Building 2 (street-side and right above the lobby), was slightly larger and brighter, and had large shuttered windows. The bed was comfortable. I was surprised that the room didn't have a desk - a pretty important amenity when traveling for work. Otherwise the furnishings were fine. The wifi was pretty reliable. The rest of my stay was just so-so. A couple of gripes: - Breakfast doesn't begin until 8AM - pretty useless if you are traveling on business. Considering it's just a cold continental buffet I don't see why they couldn't put it out an hour earlier - I was seriously annoyed on my first night to be startled awake by the in-room alarm clock that had been set by the previous guest and not turned off. This is detail that should be on Housekeeping's check-list in between guests, and it an unacceptable detail to miss in my opinion. - Pretty much every outdoor area in the hotel permits smoking. There was even an ash tray and smokers' seating area directly outside my room on the terrace/walkway between rooms. No wonder half the rooms stink of smoke! - I slept with earplugs, but if I didn't I would have been quite disturbed by noise at night, not just from the street but also from the courtyard within the hotel and guests coming and going. Overall I am still very glad I chose to stay in the French Quarter at a historic property, especially as I got a pretty great rate on the room. The location is perfect. I may choose to stay here again if it was for a leasure trip, but not for business.

Reviews.Title: “French Quarter Wedding”
Reviews.Author: Twig0319
Reviews.Content: Late review. French Quarter Wedding. I selected this hotel for our wedding after much research on Trip Advisor and personal knowledge of the Quarter. We stayed Feb. 23 â€“ 28, 2011. Had a block of 15 rooms scattered throughout the hotel including building 500 at the back of the property. If you are looking for a hotel that exudes the French Quarter this is it. Yes it is old. Yes the furniture is worn. Yes things may not quite work like a 5 â€“ star hotel. However, the property is well maintained. The beds were comfortable. The rooms were clean. The plumbing lacked at times. The staff was accommodating and friendly. The hotel was decorated for Mardi Gras. We have found with anything in New Orleans â€œjust askâ€�. This is not a cookie cutter hotel. If you want all the ultra-modern conveniences stay at the Hilton. If you want the charm and ambience of the French Quarter stay here. If you are planning a small wedding in the Big Easy, you should consider this hotel. We traveled in from the Baltimore area and everything we did was set-up by phone and email. The staff was awesome in helping us prepare for the wedding. The photographer, musician, and the selections suggested for a group dinner were all spot on. A short civil ceremony was held in the courtyard next to the fountain. Robert was extremely helpful with on-site preparations. The courtyard fountain was also the gathering point for everyone in the party. From the morning coffee to the afternoon wind-down it was the place to relax. The hotel is convenient to the back end of the Quarter- a short walk to The French Market and Jackson Square.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Nice staff”
Reviews.Author: lowhite
Reviews.Content: Not far from boubon street or Decatur street yet far enough to be calm and quiet. Staff very helpful with tours info and recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Nikki S
Reviews.Content: I came to New Orleans with a friend and we fell in love with the city. Our room was nice and the beds were really comfortable. The front desk was so helpful in pointing us towards some of the best meals we had on the trip. The best thing about this hotel though is the location. It's right around the corner from Cafe du Monde, and an easy walk to both the heart of the French Quarter and to Frenchman's Street. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Authentic New Orleans Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rachelcox404
Reviews.Content: My husband & I cashed in some bank points for 2 nights at this hotel so we could attend a Saints game. Wasn't expecting much-- thought it would be a little run-down- but boy I was wrong!!! This place is stunning! Beautiful French doors leading to each room, gorgeous courtyard & pool area! Also out of the way of all the loudness of Bourbon street. Cafe du monde is right around the corner too!! We will definetly stay here next time! Beds are really comfy & staff is very friendly-- made us feel right at home!! Made you feel like you were back in time!

Reviews.Title: “Good overall value”
Reviews.Author: kenglish7
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a conference and stayed here for 4 days. The hotel is an older boutique hotel with good charm, but also features a confusing layout. Most of the staff was helpful, but a couple were slow and less than helpful. The location is very good and as others have said, is in a quieter section of town. I also stayed on the top floor, but was near the elevator. My sleep was not disturbed by noise, but there were some noisy moments.

Reviews.Title: “It's pronounced "Charters" by the way.”
Reviews.Author: DoeHEAD
Reviews.Content: Though I'd been to New Orleans several times, I'd never stayed in the French Quarter. So I chose the Provincial mostly because of its amazing location. But I wasn't at all prepared for the utter attractiveness of the place: low-rise balconied buildings and courtyards with trees, fountains and tropical plants, populated by an out-of-their-way gracious, friendly and helpful bell and desk staff, It's best to mention that this hotel is crafted from a number of ancient buildings in the quieter end of the French Quarter. It's rooms vary and are furnished primarily with antiques. My own spacious room was on the second floor overlooking one of the courtyard pools. This hotel's location is certainly its strong point. From here it's an easy stroll to sample the frenzy of Bourbon St. nightlife, or to taste beignets and chicory coffee at the Cafe du Monde, or to enjoy the painters and musicians in Jackson Square, or to catch sunrise on the Mississippi levee. And don't overlook the adjacent restaurant, Stella!, which is just across the carport from the hotel lobby. Though pricey, and a tad prim, Stella! appeared to provide every diner with five or six waitpersons, all of whom treated me impeccably despite my casual clothing. And my meal was...well...out-of-this-world. If you're looking for a dining treat, in a city filled with great dining options, this exceptional restaurant certainly fills that bill. The only off-notes for me at the Provincial were my smallish bathroom (the toilet area was a bit cramped for a large-ish fellow), and the somewhat confined breakfast area. Though I quickly discovered that one could take breakfast items outside to the adjacent courtyard and enjoy the morning seated among the wrought iron garden furniture by one of the fountains. How civilized is that!?! Once I returned home, I discovered that an office colleague had also found the Provincial on his own and loved it. He mentioned that it is supposedly the most haunted hotel in the country. "No surprise," I thought. I bet some people find it so enjoyable that they can't bring themselves to leave. It certainly charmed me.

Reviews.Title: “Such a great experience here.”
Reviews.Author: hellozombies
Reviews.Content: My friends and I saved up and got one of the petite suites for a friend's birthday weekend, and I have to say, it was money well spent. This location was fantastic--still in the French Quarter but enough away from the hustle and bustle that it was quiet at night. We chose this hotel based on its haunted reputation and were quite pleased to have a couple of unexplained circumstances over the weekend--one within fifteen minutes of arrival. Absolutely beautiful hotel and courtyard, the room itself was spectacular, and the staff were phenomenally helpful and kind. Though we mainly spent our time out and about in the French Quarter, the time we did spend at the Provincial was fantastic. Highly, highly recommended, despite the steep price. Totally worth saving up for.

Reviews.Title: “Overall average but good location”
Reviews.Author: simone211
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Provincial for 3 nights. It is in a good location - nice and quite but close enough to all the hot spots. The room we were in (500 block) was at the back of the hotel and was very noisy as it was next to the lift and some large air con vents on the ground floor which kept us up, other guest were very noisy and woke us up several times during our stay. The room was large enough, bathroom small and the room was stuffy and hard to breath. We only had breakfast one morning and it was average but would do for some, we left early the day we checked out and would not allow us to take a muffin or bagel on the way as it was before 8am, which I thought was a little rude. The courtyards are lovely if you are staying near them and not at the back end of the parking lot. The staff were fine but not as friendly or as helpful as I have experienced in other hotels. I would reccomend this hotel to others but if we returned we would try somewhere different.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Aislingwheelworx
Reviews.Content: Great location. Gorgeous building. Breakfast was really good. Staff were so helpful. Really enjoyed our stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: mizliz05
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location in the French Quarter in a hotel with high standards. Very helpful staff, offered their very good advice on restaurants and places to go.

Reviews.Title: “The only place I will stay in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: RAlayne
Reviews.Content: My family and I have been staying at the Hotel Provincial for 10+ years, and it is usually the only place we will stay. The staff remembers us every time we visit, and does everything imaginable to make every stay unforgettable. I returned to the Provincial with my husband years after a trip with my family, and it was still as wonderful as I had left it. The beauty of the courtyard, charm of the brick paths and bubbling fountains, and glow of the gas lamps will transport you back in time while still providing modern day luxuries.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint hotel right in the French Quarter and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: MNroadtrippers66
Reviews.Content: We were at the Hotel Provincial for 3 nights and loved it. We had a room that opened into the beautiful courtyard. This hotel is older, but that's to be expected in the French Quarter. The room was comfortable, clean and cozy. The bathroom was quite small, but we expected it to be small. The AC/Heat was very quiet. There was no microwave, refrigerator or coffeemaker in the room, but there was 24 hour coffee near the lobby. Breakfast included muffins, bagels, cereal, coffee, hardboiled eggs. There was 1 luggage rack, but room on the dresser for a 2nd suitcase. The TV had 40+ channels. The hotel staff was pleasant and helpful. The location is ideal if you want to walk almost anywhere in the French Quarter. Also, this location is much quieter than the hotels on Bourbon Street. Be advised - there is a daily valet parking charge for parking your car, but almost all the hotels in the French Quarter charge for parking. However, the parking here is in a secure, enclosed parking area. The courtyard is a charming area where you can sit and drink coffee, read the paper, etc. The hotel has both a fountain and a swimming pool within the courtyard area.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: fuzzypuppy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice! I really have no complaints. (except the breakfast did not have waffles..waffles are important to me) I stayed in building 5 so it was on the older side but it was very well maintained. The elevator was on the slow side but I was on the second floor so I only really used it when I had luggage. The location is great and the affordable price for the location is better. Parking was also among the cheapest of the hotels I researched. The staff were very friendly and helpful as well. When it was raining hard, they gave me an umbrella to use for the day until I could go and buy my own.

Reviews.Title: “Not Like it Once Was”
Reviews.Author: califken
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Provincial was once a great hotel in the French Quarter. The staff is still very helpful and very nice. They want to help but the physical state of the hotel is not good. Our room was definitely on the shabby side. The hotel was very noisy both at night and in the morning. Other than the staff the location is the best feature of the hotel. We will not stay there on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Not very impressive”
Reviews.Author: ovolacto
Reviews.Content: I'm reading the reviews to the left, and thinking to myself, "What?" I was pretty stoked to come here, but pretty disappointed once I arrived. Since there are "five" buildings associated with this hotel, I can only assume the others stayed in a different building. We stayed in building "five" which is supposed to be the oldest and most haunted. In case you did not know, the Hotel Provincial is supposed to be one of the most haunted places in New Orleans. As near as I can tell, the only thing haunting this place is the lack of money to fix it up a bit. But, if you don't get your hopes up, there are things to like about this place. For one thing, I loved the location. It is down town, (down river) in New Orleans, and just a half block away from both the old Convent of the Ursuline Nuns, and a half block away from the Beauregard/Keyes House. Also, since it is on Chartres Street, it is a short walk from Jackson Square, the St. Louis Cathedral, and Cafe du Monde. It's not too far from Bourbon Street, either. The location, the history, and the price are all great, but it goes down from there. Our room was almost completely devoid of significant decoration. I understand keeping with the historic designation, but the room was bland, poorly kept, and in need of repair. Our faucet dripped the whole time we were here, the air-conditioner was very noisy, and this was the only hotel room I have ever stayed in that did not have any tourist information in it at all. The only information in this room was a local phone book. Don't get me wrong. I didn't entirely hate the place. The staff was friendly and accommodating. The continental breakfast was adequate, and I loved that high-speed internet was included in the price. If you can get a good deal on this place, (as we did), take it, just don't expect too much and you'll be OK. After all, you aren't in New Orleans to spend all day in your room, right? Oh, by the way, you might be interested in this little note on the service. When we arrived, the clerk at the desk gave our keys to the bellman to show us to our room. He did not even offer to open a door or carry our luggage. Then, when we were out of site of the clerk, but in visible range of the building, he pointed out which building was ours, gave us our keys, and left. I guess he couldn't be bothered to take us the other 30 yards to the building, and up the stairs to our room.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: bigchez11
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel people are so nice that run it .rooms were clean and well equipped.nice pool and kept clean.hotel is in heart of french quarter short walk to see things and eat.bus tours sold at hotel we took one of city it was great.small free breakfast comes with room.a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel with rooms on quiet courtyard”
Reviews.Author: CandCPhilly
Reviews.Content: Is it possible to find a quiet hotel room in the French Quarter? Yes, if you stay at the Hotel Provincial. Most of the rooms face an interior courtyard (be sure to ask for one) away from the hubbub out on the street. The bed was extremely comfortable. Good I had an alarm, or I would have overslept. Staff at the front desk go out of their way to be of assistance. This place is a keeper.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Decent Hotel in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: flwrpeep
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel Oct. 26-29, 2011. The staff were great. There is a basic continental breakfast included. A great perk is that coffee and tea are available 24/7. We asked for a courtyard room, which was quieter than a street room. The courtyard hours are 8:00 am - 11:00 pm so we didn't have to worry about rowdy partiers when we wanted to sleep. It was nice to sit out there with a cup of coffee in the morning. The room was ok, nothing spectacular, but adequate. It could have been a little cleaner. The location is on the edge of the French Quarter which meant it was away from the craziness of Bourbon Street, but with easy access to wherever you'd like to go. You don't need a car if you're staying in the French Quarter. I would probably stay here again, but other favorite hotels are the Dauphine Orleans and the Hotel Monteleone. The restaurant "Stella" is there (dinner only), and is one of the best in the French Quarter. Pricey, but worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: Jenaro
Reviews.Content: This is a typical case where you get what you pay for, nothing impressive! A big plus for the hotel is its location: just a couple of blocks from the Cathedral (on the same street) in front of Jackson Square. The hotel offers complimentary breakfast (Ok for American, lame for foreigners) and parking which is very convenient as you park your car and forget about it. This hotel comprises a group of five more or less recovered buildings. I was in room #534 (building 5) and it furniture was in pretty bad shape. Ah, if you get this room and wonder about the open tube showing from the ceiling above the hand basin, it is the drainage for the air conditioner unit which drains directly into the sink below. So if you are washing your teeth be careful not to get the back of your neck all wet with condensed water. Lately, I tried to post this comment on the hotel web page (www.hotelprovincial.com) and it was censored so do not believe everything is just perfect as the messages seem to indicate.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: ma12374
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in the French Quater located in a quiet area between the craziness of Bourbon Street and the heart of the French market. You are just a few blocks away from anything that you would want to do: eat, drink, sitesee, shop! The staff is SUPER friendly and helpfull, and they have parking inside the complex. The rooms were clean, the beds were very comfortable and the continental breakfast was adequate to begin each day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful building and great value”
Reviews.Author: SouthamptonLuisa
Reviews.Content: I visited New Orleans with my other half and another couple and as we were doing a bit of a road trip and trying to fit a lot in, were keen not to spend too much money on accommodation. This was the cheapest place we stayed in the whole time we were in the States and by far the best value. The building and the rooms are beautiful (and clean) with a great little courtyard and peaceful pool. The location is right smack in the middle of the French Quarter (but far enough away from Bourbon street to be nice and quiet) and you can walk everywhere. Very close to a lot of great restauarants and has its own restaurant 'Stella' which although we didn't go there (bit too posh for the likes of us!) looked lovely. We did frequent its 'sister' restaurant 'Stanley's' just down the road which is much more casual and had THE BEST breakfasts. The staff at Hotel Provincial are very friendly and helpful and more than happy to help with recommendations for things to do and places to eat and drink. Had a great time, and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, old hotel with a lot of charm”
Reviews.Author: OcalaTraveler2011
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, about two blocked from Bourbon Street, but right in the French Quarter. Our room was one flight up a long flight of stairs. The furnishings were old, and the room had one brick wall with a fireplace. The room faced the courtyard, and was very quiet. Check-in was a pleasure. Because the street uas undergoing some construction the day I was there, I was given a discount. Breakfast was included, but it was just ok. it was served in a drab function room because the usual location was being painted. I really liked this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: galatravelevent
Reviews.Content: The bellman and the front desk personnel were wonderful but it went downhill after entering room. The room location overlooked the pool by courtyard - that's OK even though we did not request this area. The room smelled musty, moldy, stale and felt humid inside! It was like they had just turned on the AC on after being off for how long? The AC screen/vent had a great deal of dust clinging to it. We should have asked for another room but we were rushed to meet friends at a nearby restaurant Stella (which was way overpriced and over-rated). We have stayed at Hotel Provincial before (4 other times) and never had a problem with the rooms. I know that it is always hot & humid in New Orleans during the summer but this has never happened before. My wife and I both woke up with sinus headaches probably from the mold in the room. Disappointed, sorry to say.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 255100Traveler
Reviews.Content: The French Quarter location couldn't have been better. A few steps from the bustle of the French Market down by the river, and a few steps the other way to the nightlife of Bourbon Street! This restored Civil War hospital has charm in abundance! We had a second floor room overlooking a courtyard, which had a small swimming pool nestled amidst the greenery, which we could use anytime of the day or night! Beds were comfortable and our room was huge! We skipped the small continental breakfast provided by the hotel, preferring to sample breakfast at the endless number of fantastic cafes of New Orleans, or just beignets and coffee at Cafe du Monde at the French Market!

Reviews.Title: “Neat room, nice unique place”
Reviews.Author: MidwestMidagedCouple
Reviews.Content: We needed one room for just one night after visiting western LA. for a few days to catch an early flight home the next day. So we took the best price off of a travel web page. We have been to Nawlins 5 times total since katrina and have seen this hotel advertised before on our travels so we were curious. The lobby under construction for a bar area was no big deal to us. The separate buildings of the place with courtyard and parking is unique to where we have stayed before. The steps to the room could be a problem for some but the room with it's own balcony and decor was neat to us. There are plenty rooms ground floor. You are at one end of the quarter so the walk is a ways to canal street but that's what you do in the Quarter....walk....and it's good for you and fun and safe and interesting. We found the room to be just what we needed for the night being quiet and peacful and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Just so so”
Reviews.Author: Roger K
Reviews.Content: Room was up two flights of stairs and then one more to get to bedroom. Not disabled but a hassle with suitcases.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Excellent Staff - Fair Price”
Reviews.Author: markdean11
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Provincial a couple of times and it's a gem. It's located close to everything in the French Quarter, but far enough away that you don't get a lot of noise. I felt safe walking the streets around the hotel. The rooms are nice, with antique and traditional furniture - the bathrooms are a bit old, but get the job done. The place is much larger than it looks and has great - affordable - on site parking. There is also a good sized swimming pool that is NICE on a hot day - which there are many of in New Orleans! The staff is wonderful - very helpful and accommodating. Breakfast is included in the room rate. It's pretty basic - bagels, toast, pastry, hard boiled eggs and yoghurt. It wouldn't take much to make the breakfast nicer - it would be the only area where I think they could easily improve. Overall, it's a terrific hotel and my friends and I all try to stay there when we are in the city.

Reviews.Title: “You can't do better than this one!”
Reviews.Author: tripluver96
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here the last week of August. Each one of us loved it! My kids loved the two pools. The breakfasts were copious and good, but boring (the same old, same old, for we stayed over 4 breakfasts). The family-run hotel was charming and bohemian yet modern enough. Staff were friendly and accommodating. The location is very good- located in a residential section of the French Quarter yet close to everything. Should we visit New Orleans, we'll book this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: caymansilvas
Reviews.Content: Pros: great location. Friendly staff. Clean. Great deal - I booked through my anecdotes card and got 4 nights for $300 incl taxes. Cons: continental breakfast needs improvement. They are building a new breakfast area - which led to quite a bit of construction noise. Difficult to relax between the pounding of the construction and the kids screaming in the courtyard pool. If you need quiet time request a room other than the courtyard. I was also bothered by the "antiques". There is a difference between antique decor and old, broken furnishings. It's a unique place. Great part of the Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: TravlinSaz
Reviews.Content: For our first trip to The Big Easy my husband and I decided to step out of our hotel-chain comfort zone and try somewhere with a boutique-feel instead that came highly recommended by a friend. The French Quarter location is excellent, just a short walk to the energy of Bourbon street yet far enough away from the action to ensure a quiet night sleep. There were short bursts of building noise as the hotel renovates a much needed small bar and breakfast area at the front of the hotel, scheduled to be completed September 2011. Hotel Provincial may need a lick of paint here and there but that doesn't detract from it's eclectic charm. The courtyard area has strong European influences and it was hard to believe that we were still in the Deep South. The courtyard it was a perfect place to relax and recharge after a night out, and the hotel was the ideal choice for our two night stay in New Orleans. The charming aura of the hotel fitted in perfectly with the endearing bohemian atmosphere of the city itself.

Reviews.Title: “Only Place to Stay In or Near the Quarter”
Reviews.Author: mrpink1964
Reviews.Content: We have been going to NOLA for many years as I am a member of one of the large Krewes and we usually stay in the hotels around Poydras and Tchoupitoulis. Granted the quarter is crazy during Mardi Gras but so is all of NOLA and after this stay, I will take my chances with and stay at Provincial every time from hereon. Took our older kids for a quick stay and loved the accomodations, Stayed in the old Civil War hospital and it was pretty cool, especially after the Ghost tour that ended right in front and was all about the hospital. We were all waiting for a visitor that night, haha. Anyway, rooms were quaint and nicely furnished, beds were comfortable, bathrooms updated, facilities including courtyard and pool were very nice and secluded from the rest of the Quarter. Staff was helpful, friendly and special thanks to Robert in reservations! Great location near the French Market, Jackson Square, jazz bars on Frenchmen and the "nicer" part of Bourbon. Again, this is our new place to stay in NOLA and definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Unusual Value - Great Location Too”
Reviews.Author: tim m
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 days this week on a spur-of-the-moment trip. Iâ€™ve stayed at a number of hotels in NO over the years in and out of the Quarter, with mixed and sometimes disastrous results. This was definitely a pleasant find. Itâ€™s a larger hotel with multiple buildings. Stayed in room 521 which shared a large balcony with 3 other rooms overlooking a small park that had blues bands each evening. This particular room was pretty large for the Quarter. Bed was a little soft by my standards but not worn. Curtains have seen better days. A little traffic noise in the mornings but no drunk revelers at night. The staff was pleasant and accommodating without fail. Canâ€™t really add anything more, there really wasnâ€™t anything at all to complain about. Ok, parking was $23/night but try to beat that in the Quarter (parking is on-site so you can get to your car if you have a fob). The balcony really made the room (like a lot of historic buildings there youâ€™ll need to go through a ceiling height window). If youâ€™re given a choice, ask for one of those balcony rooms in building #5. And if it means anything, this is the first time Iâ€™ve gone through the trouble to leave a review on Tripadvisor. Iâ€™d recommend it that much. Oh yeah â€“ theyâ€™ll show you the pool behind the office but thereâ€™s another hidden pool behind the restaurant if you want privacy.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service - we'll be back!"”
Reviews.Author: Beth98333
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a European-style hotel, so the rooms are small but very comfortable. There are several buildings, with one that used to be a Civil War hospital, and shady little courtyards around, as well as a pool. There is a continental breakfast, and the manager personally went out to buy milk for my coffee (there is creamer there, but I only use milk). He was charming and so kind - making sure that I had a wonderful start to the day. The office staff were knowledgeable about local history and things to see and do. The valet parking service worked very well. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Full of charm but has issues”
Reviews.Author: Harleyclarkey
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks great... full of character and a collection of sympathetically restored historic buildings. Thank goodness for the French and us Europeans who left behind some lovely cities and areas for you guys to enjoy!....( Savannah. Charleston, Nakatosh, etc.) The hotel is right in the French Quarter and a mere short walk from all you want. It is also far enough away from awful Bourbon Street. The street is far too sleazy and down market for us. I have no idea how such a beautiful area has been allowed to degenerate into what it is today...a downmarket, sleaze dump with drunks everywhere. We loved the Frenchman's Street and area not too far away. Much more classy and tasty. The hotel is large and so your room could be any of the buildings. Ours was by reception on the ground floor with a wonderful patio and one of the pools right outside. So far so good. What was not good was the concrete hammer drill that was pounding concrete right directly above our heads! This started at 08.00. This should of course have been told to us when we arrived...why didn't they? Inexcusable and unprofessional. I had this out with a woman on reception who was less than cooperative. I don't think she actually saw the problem It was me who had to say I will not pay full price for this dreadful inconvenience and invasion. She offered to reduce for one night yet we were staying for two! Incredible. Here is the guest having to argue for what should have been offered straight off. Anyway she grudgingly relented and a kind of peace returned. But this was unsavoury and should never have occurred. As the guest I felt a little battered. Our bedroom was clean, comfortable and charming, with quality furnishings. Very European! The bathroom was spotless and fine. Breakfast was a total non event. The meagre offerings consisted of muffins, orange juice, coffee and tea of sorts. Yes....that was it! The hotel would be advised to skip such a "breakfast" rather than claim this is breakfast. The excuse offered that the dining room was been renovated was no excuse whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “First time staying here, and we will definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: Wkdaniel
Reviews.Content: Great location, great service. Tip: get a room at the back of the property if possible. We had a room right above the office on Chartres and it was really noisy. A room on Decatur with a balcony would be ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and Quaint!”
Reviews.Author: emalday68
Reviews.Content: This hotel is tucked inside the French Quarter - only one block from Decatur St. and two blocks from Bourbon! Great location, great staff, great room!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, reasonable price, and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: kstaunton
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice while visiting N.O. You can't beat the location, lovely courtyard with pool, and friendly staff. The rooms are very clean. We stayed in a room overlooking Rue Chartres and while a bit noisy with street traffic, it was a lovely space for the price. Would recommend it while visiting N.O., we try and stay here as much as we can!

Reviews.Title: “Two separate stays; two different buildings; both great values."”
Reviews.Author: lallatin
Reviews.Content: We made our selection based on on-line sites and reviews. Our experience was completely satisfying for comfort, convenience, service, and price. For us, the French Quarter experience was the most important thing, and a number of hotels had appeal on many levels, but Michele felt best about Hotel Provincial, and she proved right. Though she thought our suite was not quite what she expected (There WAS a river view. You just had to sit on the dresser in the living room to see it very well. It's a gable window. Our gable window in the Empress Hotel in Victoria cost a LOT more, and only disclosed more roof.) Our other stay was in a room beside the courtyard swimming pool. In other circumstances it could have been noisy. It wasn't. On-site parking is a plus, and worth the fee. Truth-be-told, half what would be charged in any SF hotel, which would have no in-and-out privileges.

Reviews.Title: “Despite the fact that it is an older hotel, very, very nice.”
Reviews.Author: DKrage
Reviews.Content: The location is great. We stayed out of curiosity over it's creepy reputation and were pleasantly surprised about how very nice it was. Big, comfortable beds. When we needed more towels or shampoo they responded quickly. Very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “great location & service”
Reviews.Author: nikkigct
Reviews.Content: we visit new orleans 2-3 times a year, usually stay in f.q..this was the first time at the provincial, and it definately won't be our last.from the minute we checked in to check out the staff,front desk,everyone we saw that worked there was super friendly and helpful.the hotel was spotless, and the location,,,,,was perfect.great resturants,galleries,music venues,everything within minutes of walking out the front door.can't wait to go back in november.one more thing check out jamie hayes gallery up on chartres great deals on some interesting art work

Reviews.Title: “I Love This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Deny777
Reviews.Content: This was my 4th stay at The Hotel Provincial and I can't say enough good about this hotel! The beds are to die for comfy, the hotel is in a quiet location (so you can sleep) yet it is just a brief walk to everything! The staff greeted me like family and made my stay even more wonderful! If you want an excellent hotel in a good location, look no further...this is the palce for you. Beautiful quiet courtyard and an excellent continental breakfast. I have no desire to stay any place else. The Provincial has it all!!!!! Thank you for making my trip to New Orleans feel like "I'm home".

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here for the last 10 years”
Reviews.Author: jerway
Reviews.Content: We have brought 24 to 48 people with us for the last 10 years to New Orleans. When we found Hotel Provincial we could not have been happier. They have taken care of us better than ever expected. The only year we missed it was the week of Katrina. The staff is outstanding and the rooms quaint. The location is perfect in the Quarter and yet away from all the noise. Each room is different.

Reviews.Title: “Budget friendly, good location, great staff, but showing its age.”
Reviews.Author: Jenneu
Reviews.Content: We found the Hotel Provincial at the last minute on-line (two days before our stay), as New Orleans was going to be our last stop on our way home from our Texas to North Carolina and back road trip. It was quite a deal, costing a last minute special rate online of $103.55 per premium two double bed room per night with a $23 cost for valet parking. The location is definitely ideal for walking your way around the French Quarter and for the one night we stayed, even though our two rooms (104, 105) were on the first floor surrounding the courtyard pool, they were quiet. The rooms were clean and neat, but showing their age a bit. They were small, but fit two comfortable double beds with about 2 ft of space between them. Room 105 smelled damp and smoky. Both rooms cooled well and quickly overnight but stayed humid (guessing from being so close to the pool). The staff were great, espeically when we had to cut our trip a day short because of an issue back at home.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location with a nice room and pool”
Reviews.Author: Los-Alamos-NM
Reviews.Content: We (two adults and two teenagers) spent three nights (two at $109/night and one night at $99/night plus parking) here in early June 2011. Check in was easy and organized. There is a real nice patio area with a fountain and several table of rod iron furniture. The pool was nice and clean. Construction was going on, but it was organized and not disruptive. The breakfast in the back of the property was fine too. The hotel is 2.5 blocks from Jackson square church. We parked our car and walked the whole time.

Reviews.Title: “Best location closest to French market!”
Reviews.Author: Lovesgreatfood_9
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in NOLA many times and always travel down in the summer for the creole tomato and zydeco festival in June. This hotel is by far in the best location, and very close to French market. We don't go to Bourbon street very much so this was a plus for us. We stayed in a room over the restaurant Stella which did have Z fabulous comfortable king bed!! The rooms all have French doors. The only drawback to staying over the restaurant is that the drivewY into the hotel runs right below your room so you can hear the bellman, cars, etc. This room had a fabulous air conditioner so as long as it was running you could not hear anyone on the walkway outside your door. But, as soon as it would shut off we could hear every single conversation anyone was having outside. Also, as this was our anniversary trip we were disappointed that NOONE at the hotel acknowledged it whatsoever. In fact, when we checked in at approximately 10:30 a.m. On a Thursday morning, she was not pleasant at all and acted as if we were "putting her out" when my husband asked her a few questions. Had it not been for the amazingly sweet and welcoming bellman we would have been totally offended. Because our room wS not ready he graciously stored our luggage for us. When our room was ready a couple of hours later SHE called my husbands cell phone and said " your rooms ready, ok??" then hung up. We did not feel welcomed by her at all. We assumed she had worked the night shift because she was so cranky. We have stayed at W hotels and they always acknowledged our anniversary with champagne, chocolates etc. Which was so nice!! We may return there next year! On the upside the pool is fabulous and looks new with plenty of room to swim. There was a highschool group of kids staying all around the pool so they were running in and out of doors until late at night which made it difficult to sit out by the pool late at night. Overall, we slept great, the bathrooms need updating, there was very little water pressure (which seems to be a norm in NOLA) :(

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, but a Bit Shabby”
Reviews.Author: ToodieD
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a week while attending a convention. We chose this hotel as many of our fellow conventioneers were staying here as well. The best thing about this hotel is it's location: Very close to the street car that takes you along the river to Riverwalk; on the edge of the French Quarter so away from Bourbon St; lots of great restaurants within easy walking distance. If you decide to stay here, be aware that the hotel is located on a busy street corner with trucks going by on starting at 5 am. Be sure you get an inside room facing the courtyard. We requested a quiet room only to have to move because our room was on Ursuline and very noisy. This hotel is in bad need of a overhaul: Carpets need cleaning; rooms need repainting--just generally shabby. This may not be true of the new section at the back of the property. On the plus side, the front desk staff were very polite, efficient and helpful--couldn't have asked for better service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: suecstheworld
Reviews.Content: Hotel Provincial is in a wonderful location, near enough to the night life in the French Quarter, but far enough away to enjoy a peaceful, relaxing break. We stayed at Hotel Provincial at the beginning of May, we were 'in town' for the Jazz Fest (what an experience!). Hotel is just lovely, with the right amount of antique furniture to give it that 'Old World Charm' ambience. Room was a good size, with plenty of hanging space for clothes in the bathrom. We were lucky enough to get a room with access to the balcony. Great for people watching and enjoying a drink whilst listening to the music from the restaurant across the road. Staff at check in and out were very efficient and pleasant, the sort of service we have had at most US hotels on our travels! House keeping were very discreet, never saw a housekeeper, but room was spotlessly clean. Continental breakfast and all day coffee were most welcome as a start to the day. If you decide to get pastries from the bakery just around the corner, go early, you can queue for ages! To sum up, a lovely hotel with great staff, good prices for Jazz Fest week. We will probably return to New Orleans in the future and will definately stay at Hotel Provincial.

Reviews.Title: “All round amazing experience in New Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: SophieYoung
Reviews.Content: New Orleans in itself is an unforgettable experience. This hotel was in a fantastic location to explore the French Quarter. Really eye catching and well looked after, beautiful rooms with lovely furniture. Gorgeous swimming pool which we visited every morning. All in all the only fault I could pick was the shower went hot and cold which was slightly annoying, but wouldnt stop me going back. The whole place is completely mind blowing.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Wendi75001
Reviews.Content: There's not enough to say about our stay at the Hotel Provincial. This was my 3rd trip in 2 years to New Orleans, and the first stay here after hearing about it on one of the night tours. We staying in Building 5, in a balcony room overlooking Decatur St. The ONLY complaint would be the street noise from the firetrucks driving through the street on our first night. My bed was the most comfortable I've ever slept in. Staff was more than willing to help with any questions we had. Even the night guards at the parking lot gates were super friendly. Would definitely recommend to anyone a stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Fairly priced French Quarter Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hhiguy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was picked by our fellowship group for the rotary Convention, and they couldn't have found better.The hotel is situated in a quiet area of the french quarter, and is a short walk to the Jackson Square area. The staff is very freindly and efficient. The hotel is deceiving, since it looks smaller than it really is. It has five buildings surrounded by a beautiful courtyard. We stayed in building one and had canopy queen sized beds. I usually don't sleep well the first night away from home, but her i slept soundly. The hotel has wi-fi, Hi def, and serves a continental breakfast. It has a pool and most amenities you'd find for a hotel, tough the atmosphere is quaint and quite NOLA. My only compalint is that except for building five there are no elevators. .

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: xJEFFROx
Reviews.Content: I try to hit the French Quarter a couple times every year and have stayed at most of the hotels in that district now. Some look like they are going to be nice, but when you get there - surprise! This one actually is nice... The French Quarter is a historic district, so all of the hotels were built a very long time ago. his one has been restored very nicely, and is clean and quite habitable. Bring your swimming suit because the salt water pool is very refreshing after wandering around on a sunny & humid day.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant, quiet, great location”
Reviews.Author: NCARalph
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for Jazz Fest and will probably stay there again. The room was a nice size and very well decorated with a small balcony looking out over the old Ursuline Convent. Very nice at night although very small and we had to move chairs out from the room. Ursuline street itself is very quiet at night even though the hotel is just a few blocks from the French quarter, the Marigny and the riverfront and this was during Jazz Fest! The only problems with the hotel we found were that the staff was very disorganized about the reservation and keeping the door key authorized, and the buffet breakfast was quite minimal. Overall though we like it a lot. Stella! restaurant is at the hotel although you have to make separate reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: km18766
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, it is charming, quaint and beautiful. We stayed in a second story room facing the main street. The french doors that opened up to the outside were gorgeous. There is a wonderful courtyard and pool. We didn't find out that the hotel is supposedly haunted until the ghost tour made frequent stops in front of our window. This hotel is in walking distance to most places in the French Quarter, including Cafe Du Monde and Bourbon Street.

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay here, still love it!”
Reviews.Author: rpdmom
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay here. The location is excellent, right in the heart of the French Quarter. The staff is extremely nice and accomodating, and if they dont know something, they are willing to find out and get back to you. The courtyard in the front building is a nice place to sit and relax in between sight seeing. The rooms are all different, and are in several different buildings. My first stay we had a double room with a balcony overlooking Decatur Street. I asked for that again, and instead recieved a room with walkways overlooking the courtyard and pool areas. Since the room was bigger and worked out great for us, I did not complain. Our friend asked for a king suite with balcony, and he got a fire escape.....so just beware, the hotels idea of a balcony may not jibe with your idea of one. Also valet parking is $23/day whether you take your car out or not (common for the hotels in that area). Other than that, our room was clean and pretty spacious, the bathroom was really nice with a closet and seperate shower/toilet area. The housekeeping service was awesome, they did a great job. I still would always pick this as a place to stay, it is one of the more reasonable French Quarter hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Small Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jimtho
Reviews.Content: For the price the Provincial is an excellent bargain. The location is perfect and the staff excellent. We had several unforeseen changes occur and Robert and Natalie did an outstanding job making everything happen. Jerome, Dana and Terry took care of all our reservations etc. The room was of good size and the beds excellent. This is an older hotel with thick walls but the doors are also very old but not very sound proof for the noise generated by Bourbon St returnees at 2/3:00 in the AM! There is no coffee maker, microwave or refrig in the rooms, there is a very nice 30" flat screen. The room was very clean!! The breakfast was adequate: bagels,hard boiled eggs, pastries, juice, fruit and coffee. If you are a bacon and eggs guy you need to walk dwn a couple of blocks to Stanleys. The courtyard was beautiful and a perfect place to relax in the afternoon or have your breakfast and coffee.There is a computer and printer in the lobby for guest use. I would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint French Style Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chris1955May
Reviews.Content: As are many New Orleans hotels, this one was French and quite quaint. The room was disconnected from the main lobby. The location was perfect and just down the street from Jackson Square. The staff was always respectable and was at our beckon call. The room was quite clean, quiet and comfortable. We never heard anyone else during our stay at this hotel. The most difficult part, as the weather was not cooperating, was our inability to eat our continental breakfast in the lobby. You either had to find a small available table and chair, or you had to take it back to your room. The other place to sit and eat was outdoors.

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay Ever!”
Reviews.Author: sparkyygirl
Reviews.Content: I go to New Orleans every year for Easter to visit family and then stay in the French Quarter. I have stayed at many different hotels here. I am so glad that I again stayed here. I was concerned about my rental car-no worries here. The people at the desk were so helpful and kind with everything. They also had a great sense of humor. The beds are so comfortable. This hotel has a lot of charm and is close to everything. I would stay here again and can highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bettyblueFlorida
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at this hotel because he was attending a conference here. We were not expecting much and were pleasantly surprised. The hotel room was large and clean. The decor was a little old fashioned for my taste but it suited the historic building. The bed was extremely comfortable. Our room faced Chartres St. and had these huge louvered windows. They were gorgeous but at night you can here every conversation, every car and every horse and carriage clip clop down the street. If you are a light sleeper, request a room further back. The hotel offers many quiet little courtyards to relax in and a rather basic continental breakfast. We walked to Cafe Du Monde which is only a few blocks away. The hotel also offers coffee and tea all day, and the staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The location could not be better. It was really close to all of the sights but far enough away to escape the late night craziness on bourbon street.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong here!”
Reviews.Author: mel-rph-cat
Reviews.Content: We decided to head to New Orleans prior to going to Destin. My daughter, her friend and me. It was a last minute decision and the place I usually stay at was full. Chose this hotel from the Official Visitors Guide that I get annually from New Orleans Tourism. It was great! We arrived before check in, no problem. We let them park the car and took off for the Aquarium. Recieved a call while there that the room was ready. What a nice service. We stayed in a room off the pool area that was close to the parking area which was great for us. We could go back and forth to get things from the car and not have everything in the room.. Close to the French Market and Jackson Square. I like the location better than other places I have stayed that were closer to Canal Street. We ate at Gallatoires, The Market Cafe, Oceania, and Irene's Cuisine which is just down the street. Don't miss Crossiant D'Or on Ursuline's for breakfast. An interesting side note. We took a ghost tour and the hotel was one of the stops! Also I was trying to book this hotel in advance for next year and the reservation clerk called me when I was at home to try to help me. That was definitely going above and beyond! Thank you Hotel Provincial, We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Zuzu1234
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with bf & friends for a week during Feb for bday/vacation. Had always wanted to come to NOLA! Finding the right location was key when I was researching since we were planning to not rent a car which I do not regret at all BTW. The hotel was short cab ride from the airport. When we went to check in our rooms were not ready but the front desk was glad to lock up our luggage while we explored the area. Once ready everything was smooth & effortless. We booked through expedia which I do for work often and had ZERO issues what so ever. No hidden charges, extra fees, unwanted surprises - ETC from the hotel. (They do charge for parking if you do have a car $22 per day but its a secure lot with valet that brings the car right out for you.) We got a chance to see 2 types of rooms since my friends where in one location (right off the courtyard) and us another (building 500). I guess some of the rooms in building 500 are suppose to be haunted (why I booked the location ;oD) but we did not experience anything. Both rooms were comfortable w/ that old world charm. (Its not modern but clean and quiet at night!!) Beautiful Courtyard to relax, read, have breakfast & coffee. (They have a pool but it was to cold to swim when we went/they have restaurant on-site Stella but didnt get a chance to go - its $$$$$). Front Desk was helpful with everything from directions, dining recommendations, to tour suggestions even booking tours for us at a discount. A computer was available for free as well to print out boarding passes on our last day. They serve a free cont .breakfast. Mind you it isnt glam but has the basics: fruit, bagels (toaster), danish, muffins, coffee, tea, juice and hard boiled eggs which you dont often see at cont. breakfast. Enough to start the day with something in your stomach and save a little $$. Coffee/Tea served all day. The hotel was close to everything: French Market, Original Cafe du Monde, Jackson Square, Cathedral, Riverwalk, Bourbon, Frenchmen St etc etc. (These directly behind the hotel.)
