If you are lucky enough to be in the back building of the hotel you can hear amazing music from the streets at the French market. We walked everywhere. Since it was so beautiful a walk felt like 5 minutes but could have been 20 or more. We lucked out because the weather was gorgeous all week - Sunny and 60-70's. Food Recommendations: Quarter Master which is like a mini mart (if you forgot to pack something) but has a deli counter in back for breakfast/lunch/dinner - good Cheap Eats!! Mona Lisa Pizzeria - Great Pizza/Salad, Louisiana Pizza Kitchen - Amazing Food, Best Po'Boy was Royal Street Cafe -Catfish Po'Boy was AMAZING, NOLA by Emeril - our splurge but was worth it. Take your time to check out places to eat - there are so many to choose from you can go all out some nights and take it down a notch on others - cost wise!! When we come back to NOLA I would stay hear again in a minute!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Liz676
Reviews.Content: My husband and our finished our trip around the US in New Orleans and our last hotel was by far the best. Great character, clean, unbeatable location convenient to all sights in the Quarter but far enough away to get a quiet night's sleep and great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Still our favorite hotel location in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: OttoCal
Reviews.Content: This was the hotel I stayed at 11 years ago on my first trip to New Orleans, and after a fun adventure at an enchantingly quirky B&B a few years ago (click my profile and scroll though the old reviews if you want to learn about that), it was back to Hotel Provincial. This really is our favorite location in the French Quarter. I like that it is close to the Marigny neighborhood, because I think that the close proximity to those restaurants and music venues is great. We arrived around 1 pm on a Wednesday, and were greeted by a charming lady, she got us registered, and arranged to drop off our bags, then gave us a map and sent us out with 3 lunch suggestions. She said they would call when our room was ready. The posted check in time was 3 pm, which we knew, and having a room ready early is just the luck of the draw I think. Her lunch suggestions were Coop's Place, Fiorella's (both on Decatur about a block away) and The Gumbo Shop a littler farther away. We already knew and liked Coop's anyway, so we went there, had a delicious lunch, and actually did get a phone call from them at about 2 to let us know our room was ready. That was neat, I never actually had that happen before. Is this just me? Do you normally get called to say your room is ready if you check in early? It was appreciated. Our room was #210, on the 2nd floor in the courtyard over the pool. This hotel has funny sections, there are 2 main courtyards, one with a fountain, one with a pool. Then there are more rooms tucked around the side that are on a smaller fountain courtyard, and then I think there are some with small balconies overlooking Ursulines Street. The room was cute, nice looking antique-style furniture. The door had glass shutters that could open and also stay closed and adjust the louvers from the inside, and this faced the pool area. Average in size. The bathroom had a split toilet/shower room from the sink/vanity. This is a nice feature for couples to get ready at the same time. Standard toiletry amenity package. Decent towels- not skimpy, not overly plush. The pool in late March was still a bit chilly for all but the hardiest of guests. We are hardy, but were too busy for a dip, darn! Also, because it is in a courtyard, you have to time the sun right if you want to be in a sunny spot. I am sure this is not an issue in the summer, when you drip sweat even in the shade... This hotel is often popular with groups, and the groups tend to congregate in the courtyard areas for some conversation and drinks. When a large group was up later than us in the fountain courtyard, we couldn't hear them at all from the pool courtyard area. The pool area states that it closes at 10 pm. We were never bothered by noise from other people, but I think if you were super sensitive, and there were groups outside up late & hanging out in the courtyard, you might be bothered. Our only complaint was the shower. The shower head was short for us. We're on the taller side (5'7" + 6'1") and it was a little comical, but we got clean. And you got a cold blast if a neighboring room flushed the toilet. At least I assume that is what sped the cold blast along. It was the right timing for it anyway. We did not partake of the free continental breakfast, which looked like coffee, pastry and fruit. We prefered the Croissant d'Or shop around the corner on Ursulines Street. Excellent Croissants- so flaky & buttery, not those yucky ones you get that taste like bad danish in some places! YUM. Also fun was the chocolate espresso, and their take-away sandwiches looked good too. If you have the time, a visit to the Beauregard-Keyes House and Old Ursulines Convent- both across the street from the hotel- are both worthwhile. B-K House, allow 1 hour, tours hourly, Convent- self-guided with a flyer tour, tour guide available inside who just keeps rotating through the rooms but isn't on a set schedule. We found the staff to be pleasant and helpful, and aside from the funky shower issues, there was nothing that would entice us away from Hotel Provincial for our future visit. We're more likely to be found on Decatur Street than Bourbon Street these days, but HP is easy walking distance anywhere in the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for the shower & get a room in the back!”
Reviews.Author: ictfatboy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is away from Bourbon street enough that it is quiet at night, but our room at the front of the hotel near the check in area was very noisy in the morning due to people loading their cars and dragging the luggage carts across the cobble stone drive. Checkout time was noon and we were awakened twice by the cleaning staff, once at 9 and again at 10 to ask if we were leaving that day. I don't believe I should have to put up a DO NOT DISTURB sign until after checkout time, so maybe I am to blame, but a note to remember to other travelers. I have not had this problem at other hotels. The water in the shower during the evening was VERY erratic and would go from warm to hot to freezing back to scalding hot, etc. Good pressure, but hard to enjoy a shower. That occurred about 8 pm when I expect alot of usage. I showered again the next day about 11 am and the problem was non existent, so I suspect just alot of usage contributes. Shower when everyone else isn't! Parking was secure. I would stay there again, but I would get a room at the back where I think it would be quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Love, love, love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: LARTampa
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at Hotel Provincial in New Orleans. The rooms were clean and the beds are very comfortable. It was close enough to the action of the French Quarter but yet nice and quiet at night. Very close to the french market and outdoor shopping area. The courtyards were beautiful and great for gathering with our friends for breakfast and in the evening. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: KJB
Reviews.Content: 2 cousins and I went to N'awlins to celebrate a 50th birthday. We stayed at the Hotel Provincial in room 523. It has 2 double beds AND a window that is from the floor to almost the ceiling. It opens up to a balcony with wrought iron tables and chairs. The balcony overlooks Decater Street. We spent a lot of time on the balcony watching the road and pedestrial traffic. There was lots to see and we had a great view. Also, the French Market is across the street. One of the restaurants had a live band, so we had a great view and wonderful music. As mentioned previously, the carpet could stand to be replaced and the bathroom is pretty small. However, remember this is an old hotel. Old Hotels = smaller bathrooms. The tub was regular size, but there was only 1 sink. When you've got 3 women and a 1 sink bathroom you'd think we'd have trouble with that bathroom, but we just took turns and it really worked out fine. Building 5 is the one that is supposedly haunted, we didn't experience anything ... darn it. Even though our room was over Decater Street it was quiet at night and we slept very well. Comfy beds. There are no safes in the rooms, but you can use safety deposit boxes in the lobby for free. The staff always seemed happy to help us. All three of us enjoyed the hotel very much and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Spirit(s) of New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: MarkBearSF
Reviews.Content: We had a delightful stay at the Hotel Provincial during Mardi Gras. The staff & service were impeccable. The grounds are beautiful with multiple courtyards, pools & fountains. We didn't encounter any ghostly residents but the spirit of this city permeates the place.

Reviews.Title: “Tired”
Reviews.Author: BobH45
Reviews.Content: First for good. Front desk personnel and bellman very accomodating, Bed lenins and pillows excellent. Once you get past sound of A/C, it works well. Now for the bad. Room, lighting and furnishings very tired. Carpet grungy. Chandelier arms cockeyed. Bathroom worst since college dorm 45 years ago. Used bandaid awaiting our arrival on floor. Elevator to 3rd floor and room 534 smelly.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location near all the action of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: dancer45
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Provincial based on Tripadvisor reviews. Having been to the French Quarter several times over the past 10 years I was familiar with the location and knew this was the part of the Quarter I wanted to stay in. We were stopping over for the night on the way to Florida. It's a lovely historical buildings in a Plantation style that is very inviting from the get go. The one thing I love about the Quarter is what is behind the walls of the buildings and this place does not disappoint. The valet was right there to greet us and check-in was easy. We had several heavy suitcases but was aptly aided by the valet. All the rooms are off an outside corridor overlooking a beautiful courtyard and shouldn't be a deterrent. The rooms are spacious and the bathrooms were fine if not a bit outdated but again, this is a historical building and everything was clean and functioned well. There is a beautiful, huge pool located in the back courtyard and looked extremely inviting. My only negative review is that the walls are a little thin. We had some revelers in the room next to us (Mardi Gras was in full swing) who weren't totally obnoxious and quieted down around midnight. I honestly didn't have a problem with it but I did hear them nevertheless. Being that it was high-season, the week before Fat Tuesday, I felt we got a very good deal for 150.00 per night.

Reviews.Title: “The Provincial is a fine, traditional New Orleans hotel in a good location and at a good rate.”
Reviews.Author: RodChap
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful, old, unique New Orleans hotel. If you're looking for big, shiny, and modern, go elsewhere. The staff was friendly and helpful, the room comfortable and quiet, and the location unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Four peaceful nights”
Reviews.Author: GuideVerte
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights in February at the Provincial on the 3rd floor of the 500 building. The room had a large desk for my laptop, a small table and chairs, a dresser, a flat screen TV and a king size bed. The room overlooked Decatur Street and the French Market. During the day, there was a jazz band that played across the street at the Gazebo Cafe, the music was a pleasant background noise for working and by 9 p.m. it was quiet even on the street. The hotel is in a pleasant part of the French quarter. I walked each day to the Marriott on Canal for a convention and the .7 mile walk which I usually took down Rue Royal was a nice window shopping experience each day. Breakfast around the corner at the Croissant D'Or is a must-do. The only negative I have is that the mattress was a bit firm for my liking and the rooms are in need of a bit of sprucing. But mattresses are very subjective and it is normal that a 100 year old building would need a bit of TLC. I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice for us!”
Reviews.Author: lhbaca
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with our 22 year old son traveled to New Orleans for a family get-away in January. I spent many hours in search of the right hotel for our stay, and I was not disappointed. The Hotel Provincial is in a great location, close enough to the French Market, Canal St. and the Bourbon St. area. At night, it is quiet and peaceful. The people at the desk are very helpful when asked for suggestions on dining, etc. The 3 of us shared a room with 2 very comfortable double beds. The TV was a new flat screen, and a mini refrigerator was placed in our room at our request. There is a continental breakfast served in the lobby, however we never made it in there. We slept in every morning and missed the spread!

Reviews.Title: “The most wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: vikequeen93
Reviews.Content: I took my daughter to new orleans for her 24th b day. We loved the hotel and the staff. You couldnt ask for a better hotel staff then they have. Everytime i asked for directions they give you a map and tell you excatly how to get somewhere. price of trolleys and so on. The room was very nice and homey. We stayed in room 114 right outside the beautiful fountain. This hotel makes you feel like your at home. I would stay here again and again. Thanks for a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Most Amazing Little Place in the Heart of the French Quater in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: marynafromSA
Reviews.Content: The location was fabulous and we could walk all over the French Quater! Nice staff, small breakfast but definately adequate; Doors a bit "thin" could hear the noise but it was great! Make use of this place, it is very special and the atmosphere was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Historic Hospital converted to hospitable hotel”
Reviews.Author: HelenaRose
Reviews.Content: Hotel Provincial consists of several buildings centrally located, yet quiet, in the French Quarter. Our room was in the lobby building, which was a hospital. At registration, the staff welcomed us and offered to help with dinner reservations. Our room was in the hospital building, two stories, with a central courtyard seating area and pool. There were two queen beds, a dressing area and shower/toilet combo. Continental breakfast is served in the lobby, with patio seating. Jackson Square is three short blocks away. Stellas' Restaurant is in the hotel and Irene's Restaurant is around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the French Quarter! 1 block from the French Market.”
Reviews.Author: imawandrer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is historic, clean, very nice! We had a room overlooking Chartres St. and thought it would be noisy, but was only moderately so. We slept well. We enjoyed the louvered doors that opened to a wrought iron railing. It was great to watch the mule-drawn buggies going by, hearing their clip-clop, so you knew they were coming! The room was average in size, with a comfortable pillow-top mattress. It had a flat-screen tv. They had a decent continental breakfast in the lobby. There was a computer for guests to use in the lobby, with fast internet service. The staff was very helpful and friendly. We spoke to a bellman when we were leaving, as we'd heard the hotel was haunted. He said the older building in the back was a Civil War hospital, and rumors are that it is haunted! We didn't find out! Very much enjoyed our stay! Definitely would recommend. This is a good location for walking almost anywhere in the French Quarter, but is only one block from the French Market, and maybe 2 blocks to the streetcar.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is ok-clean and in the Quarter, but there are better choices in my opinion.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in 2 different rooms. The first, room 311, I had to ask to be moved from. It was literally in a stair well. You could hear people walking up and down the creaky stairs all the time, and even though the ceiling was very high it just felt claustrphobic. Our second room, in the 100 building, was much better but still seemed kind of dark as the only windows are those on your door. It was clean though, and the reservation manager was kind enough to switch our rooms for us.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: CruiserIllinois
Reviews.Content: We stayed there December 26th through the 30th. The prices were $69 for one night and $89 for the other three nights. We had a room overlooking the parking lot (which was not bad since we could see if our relatives were there yet). Mainly we saw other roofs. We stayed in room 535 which is said that the 500 building is haunted since it use to be a confederate hospital. We did get a strange picture (which I will include). Breakfast was fine. I loved their big muffins. They also had coffee, juice, eggs, rolls and bagels. We were within three blocks of Jackson Square and a block to the Urseline Convent and Beuregard/Keys house. You could hear the people next door at times. They did forget to bring us soap for the first night. Not a biggie. We would like to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place + Great Hotel = Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: shill
Reviews.Content: My wife, 21 year old daughter, and myself just got back from a 5 night stay at the Hotel Provoncial in New Orleans. The hotel is a great place for families. The staff is attentive and friendly, the location is convenient, it is clean, safe, and reasonable in price. The breakfast, which is included in the room price, is nothing to write home about, but in a city with so many great places to eat, this is a minor gripe. We have stayed at this hotel twice now, and will do so again the next time we visit NO.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, beautiful, affordable, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: KristieKrejci
Reviews.Content: We could not have asked for more. Located about 6-8 blocks off the heart of Bourbon St gives you quiet sleep. Very close to Jackson Square, French Market, Margaritaville, etc (We recommend Margaritaville for inexpensive drinks, 5-6 bucks vs 8-10 on Bourbon...and you can get it to go!). The hotel is beautiful, supposedly the most haunted hotel in America according to a google search. Decor is beautiful, classic New Orleans luxury, without the price tag. Staff was friendly and the hotel was spotless. The bed was a welcome comfort after days of walking and having a great time. The only complaint: walking up a long flight of stairs to our room after walking all night and in the New Orleans heat! We LOVED this place, can't say enough good about it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Facility - Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: MillervilleMayor
Reviews.Content: We currently have one more day to our stay, but couldn't wait to write this review. Our room was in a historical building and had all that charm. The staff were outstanding and the location could not have been better. We could open up our window and listen to the music from the French Market or simply chill in the patio/pool area. The parking was on-site which is a big advantage. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “convenient”
Reviews.Author: felien28
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel in the early evening. Because of the time of year, it was already dark. After we checked in we had to find our room ourselves. We had to go back outside, walk through a narrow little street and look for the numbers on the different buildings the hotel uses for rooms. Thanks to some other nice guest we did find our room, the numbers of the blocks were barely lit. We carried our suitcases up the 23 step stairs ourselves. We are young, so that is not an issue but i can imagine that older people would get in trouble. The room was clean, no doubt about that. The bed comfortable and good pillows. The airco in the room worked well and was not noisy. The bathroom was small but was more then enough. There were soaps and shampoo but you only get those once. They don't get replaced when you use them up. We slept on the side of the convent and it was fairly quiet on that side. Only on Saturday night there was a lot of noise. The rooms have no double glazing in the windows and you really hear everything. There is TV in the room but very poor quality. There is no list of the channels. The movie network did not do anything. There is no minibar, no microwave, no coffeemaker in the room. There is an ironing board and a hair blower. Internet was available but you have to log in every time you want to use it. Breakfast is kind of little joke. It's very small and very limited. Butter, jam, and cheese. Very little variety. The coffee is available all day, as is the tea. Orange juice only in the morning. We found a little bakery around the corner that had great breakfast and you could buy things to take with you and have breakfast in the room. Overall we were happy cause we weren't that much in the room. The people that work there are not so friendly, but the girl that checked us in was. They don't ask if you need anything or if you are ok. They are totally not interested and just work there because you got to work somewhere. There is not one sign that anybody that works there loves his or her job. The pool is not really nice to swim in and housekeeping even came in the afternoon. I think this hotel is a little overpriced but it's location is great. You can walk to the french market in less then two minutes and Ducator street is just two (small) blocks away. We did not rent a car but did everything on foot. The location is great actually.

Reviews.Title: “More than what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: kimbis1957
Reviews.Content: This really is a great small hotel. You can't beat the location, it's clean and the staff is exceptionally friendly and helpful. The pool in the main courtyard is a great place to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful.”
Reviews.Author: richtersaurus
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend went on our first vacation together this summer and our first stop was New Orleans, and we happened to find this place, and I'm so glad we did. Clean rooms (there was a tiny spider on our bed, but that was it), right in the middle of the French Quarter, nice service, excellent pool, and a fantastic bed that made for a spectacular sleep. The only real complaint - broken ironing board. Other than that, great great place to stay. if/when I go back to NOLA, I'm definitely staying here!

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans experience, moderately priced”
Reviews.Author: NorthernBurt
Reviews.Content: Our second visit to Hotel Provincial held no surprises. The location is great, in the heart of the old city yet away from the noisy crowds. The rooms are adequate and comfortably furnished. Easy access for luggage, especially on the ground floor, which I prefer. Valet parking behind the hotel at $22 a night. Breakfast is minimal, but free.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms were a little cramped”
Reviews.Author: gabbysmom24
Reviews.Content: I've been to the French Quarter many, many times in my life and I've never seen this hotel until recently when I was looking online for a hotel in the French Quarter that wasn't so overpriced. It is a very clean, modest hotel. The only problem I had with it was that I thought the rooms were rather small compared to other hotels, but this is after all an old hotel. I love the fact that it is within walking distance to anything in the French Quarter. I had my two young children with me (ages 8 & 3) and felt a little cramped in the room but other than that it was a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, value for the money, Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: shepet22
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Provincial recently with my husband. We had a wonderful stay. I was actually in New Orleans for a conference but was able to work some leisure time in also.The staff was great, the pool and grounds were beautiful. Coffee in the lobby and breakfast included in the morning. All for a very reasonable price. We will definitely stay here again when we return to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Nice FQ hotel with character”
Reviews.Author: dandy_warhol
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 2 night stay in NOLA as Hotel Provncial. We were in town to check out venues for our destination wedding ceremony and reception. We worked with Margie in Sales and she arranged for our stay at a decent rate of $79/night. We stayed in the 400 building. Our room was very nice - king bed, exposed brick, fireplace. The bed was comfortable and the room clean. We toured rooms in the other buildings and they all looked quite nice - esp. the suites in the 300 building. A few of the rooms did seem a tad bit musty but not unbearable for me (perhaps for my mother.) The free breakfast was a collection of hard boiled eggs, croissants, danishes, and fruit. There was complimentary tea and coffee available all day. In speaking with Margie there are plans to expand the breakfast area in the near future in order to expand their breakfast options during the day and have an on-site bar in the evening. The only negative aspect was quickly mitigated by the maintenance man. Our shower would not turn on - the handle kept spinning and spinning and we couldn't figure out what was wrong. We called the front desk and they sent up the handy man. He fixed the handle quickly - a screw had come loose - and cleanly. Also, the free wireless internet was a bit spotty but worked, for the most part. I would recommend staying here if you are looking for a hotel with some character and history.

Reviews.Title: “These guys helped make our wedding perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Redbirds1
Reviews.Content: My new bride and I had stayed here many times and loved it. Finally, we decided to get married there this summer, and that was a great decision. The staff there was so nice and they did a great job taking care of my wife and I and our party of about 20 guests. Hotel Provincial is a beautiful old place in the heart of the French Quarter with cozy rooms and a really nice pool. (I don't think there are many pools is the French Quarter.) There's also a pleasant courtyard with a fountain where we did the wedding ceremony. It's close to everything, but it's far enough away from Bourbon that it remains peaceful. Part of the complex was once used as a Civil War Hospital and there are rumors of ghosts and such, but we've never seen anything strange (unfortunately!) Everybody in our party commented on how much they love the place and how they want to come back. My wife and I will also be returning, and we'll definitely stay at the Provincial as we have on every visit since 2000.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Honeymoon......”
Reviews.Author: kimmiemac
Reviews.Content: Eddie & Me loved Hotel Provincial. While visiting New Orleans we would refer to Hotel Provincial as home. It felt like a hpme away from home. The staff was very kind, friendly and always helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great New Orleans Experience”
Reviews.Author: clearasabelle
Reviews.Content: The staff of The Hotel Provincial is beyond compare! Our stay started with Margie, the sales manager. She helped us arrange rooms for about 20 guests from all over the country. She was a wonderful help making sure that everyone had the room type they needed. On our arrival everyone from the front desk to the bell hops were more than helpful. When my future mother-in-law wanted a diet coke, one of the staff members went out of her way to get it for her. The rooms were full of character and ambience. The hotel is a comfortable walk to everything in the French Quarter, but away from the noise and smell of Bourbon Street. The courtyards were enjoyed by everyone in our party. The parking was great because it was on site and the cars were available when needed. My husband and I stayed in the Honeymoon Suite and loved it. There was a balcony, beautiful antiques, high ceilings, and an old brick fireplace. If you want to stay in a place with lots of New Orleans character, an awesome location, and staff that goes above and beyond Hospitality....then the Hotel Provincial is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Room #526”
Reviews.Author: oikarinen
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room #526 on April 19, 2010. A beautiful clean room. Immediately I had an odd fealing. Later in the evening I went to the room alone. I was very scared. Heard noises on the hallway...went to check..no-one was there. When we returned home 3 weeks later from our U.S. roadtrip, I checked the internedt and read that especially building 500 in Hotel Provincial is haunted. Oh my god! Had I known that before, I never would have stayed there. But the hotel is great ovtherwise.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: dolally
Reviews.Content: great location. quiet but close to everything. Ask for pool side room or court yard... No extras in room (ie fridge) but from listening to others really quiet location ... and pool great . Restaurant next door great but a little bit negative towards kids (should say adults only) and my kids were really well behaved ! ) Little gem hotel in middle of french quarter but with none of the sirens !

Reviews.Title: “on a budget? Good choice, with a few tips:”
Reviews.Author: Silent Crow
Reviews.Content: If you are on a budget and want to enjoy the best of the French Quarter, I strongly recommend this hotel, with a few caveats: The rooms in the back buildings are terrific. Charming. Unique. Well-appointed. Quiet. The rooms in the main building are a bit musty, dark, and remind me of an old-folks home. The hotel is next door to Stella!, the magnificent restaurant, but the hotel itself has no food service to speak of, aside from morning coffee and a hardboiled egg or two. The location of the hotel is GREAT: While it sits in a quiet corner next to a nunnery, it's steps from the heart of it all. You can, in fact, get sleep here. And the people that work there are NICE. Not young and peppy, dapper, or particularly professional, but very, very nice. If you can't afford the Windsor court this trip, get a room in one of the rear buildings at The Provincial.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jallaway
Reviews.Content: Overall a nice experience. Furnishings and rooms were a bit dated; but it did give it somewhat of an "old New Orleans" feel. Our rate was a very good value and the staff was always nice and helpful. It's on a relatively quite street; but avoid a front room unless you want to hear mules clopping and the endless tours being given below your window.

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunate”
Reviews.Author: NorthTexPaul
Reviews.Content: We were really enjoying our stay, everybody was very helpful until the last day of our visit. We had added a day on a couple of weeks ago and we confirmed when we checked in. However, nobody told us we were going to be required to change rooms for the last day. We happened to stop by to get our car around 3 PM and found that out. We had told them in a previous phone call and on our first day that we did not want building 5, but lo and behold that is where they were sending us. So we cancelled and left. Unfortunately for all the quaintness, there was a communication gaffe and also no apology by Robert to even try to work it out. It was "it is our only room, take it or leave it". We will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to write home about”
Reviews.Author: katrinkaloo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is cute and very "New Orleans". The rooms are very basic, typical NOLA rooms. We have to remember that the city is very touristy so the rooms do get a lot of wear and tear, and if you're on a budget this is a fine choice for lodging. The location is excellent! Here are some specifics that you find helpful: - Pros: Our bed was quite comfortable and we were able to keep the temperature at a nice level. There were lots of little places to sit and relax, especially in the morning with a cup of coffee and pastry. The continental breakfast they do is a nice little touch. Go exploring around the hotel - there is more to this place than you think, lots of little hidden courtyards. - Cons: Our bathroom was in need of a remodel. The floor of the tub/shower felt unstable and everything was just a little dingy (or maybe "worn" is a better word). There was no in room safe, although there are small (and I mean small) safes behind the lobby desk for guests use. If you have anything like a laptop or professional camera that you want to put away, you're out of luck. Another downside for us was no minibar/fridge in the room and no kind of bar/lounge in the hotel. This is a big con for me because my husband and I like to have a drink and talk about our day before we get ready for dinner and nightlife. If you stay here, I would suggest requesting a room that does not overlook the street or alley or sit on top of the restaurant next door. [As a quick aside, the restaurant next door (Stella) is great as is its brother restaurant (Stanley). Go to Stanley for brunch.] If you have a room in any of these locations, don't plan on sleeping in. They get very loud, very early in the morning with deliveries and trash pick-up. To end on a positive note, I would certainly recommend this hotel to a friend who was looking for a place to stay in the quarter without having to spend a fortune. It was a pleasant place to stay and everyone who worked there was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been more pleased!”
Reviews.Author: LLoomis319
Reviews.Content: Our 4 night stay at the Hotel Provincial could not have been more charming. Our 3 standard rooms were filled with antique furnishings and the beds were very comfortable. One could sit with the windows open to the street below or cool off in air-conditioned comfort. The location at the edge of the French Quarter/French Market was perfect for walking/shopping and not far from streetcar stops to explore further out. The staff was always very friendly--continually keeping the property clean; the continental breakfast satisfying, and the pool especially inviting in the summer heat. We enjoyed sitting in the little courtyard for breakfast and again in the evening. We also enjoyed eavesdropping on the ghost tours each night, as they described all that had happened in our old Civil War hospital building many years ago. We highly recommend this property and also suggest "The Praline Connection" restaurant--just a couple blocks away too--for great Southern food.

Reviews.Title: “A true New Orleans gem”
Reviews.Author: wren3mgc
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hotel Provincial many times over the last 20 years or so and am always delighted to find the staff so friendly and helpful. The location in the Quarter is great and on-site parking is a big plus for those of us in Louisiana who drive into the city. I almost hate to rave about the Provincial as I may never again be able to get a reservation when I get the urge to visit my favorite city. Renee

Reviews.Title: “Paper-thin walls, loud courtyard, not a great area”
Reviews.Author: DarlaTo
Reviews.Content: I've been to NO quite a few times - usually stay at Place D'Armes (great hotel). Wanted to try something different this time - chose Hotel Provincial. We had a room at the front of the hotel overlooking the street - very noisy at night (walls are seriously paper-thin). Lots of kids visiting the same time we were and the hotel courtyard was filled with teenagers from a school trip that made a lot of noise during early morning hours (1:30a.m.!) in the courtyard with no warning from the front desk (which is located adjacent to the courtyard ) to keep the noise level down per their posted signs indicating that the courtyard closes at 11p.m. Towels were rationed to the point where we would only get 1 towel each day and had to request more (hand towels, wash cloths, etc.). On our first night at the hotel, two cop cars had apprehended a seedy looking character right across the street from the hotel. The next night - 2 more cop cars at the other corner. We thought this would be a quiet and safe location, but next time will return to the Place D'Armes or try another hotel in the French Quarter. Don't get a room near the swimming pool - that was packed with people and it was LOUD, LOUD, LOUD all day and night!

Reviews.Title: “Feels like New Orleans - because it is!”
Reviews.Author: IanTG
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 days, as part of our tour of the southern states. Major benefit is its location - right in the French quarter, and therefore easy to access the quarter and quayside areas, as well as trolleybus. Room rate seemed reasonable compared to other hotels around, but one does need to take into account the $22 per night additional cost for onsite car parking. That said, good that it was in secure place, and with valet parking which seemed well organised and prompt when needed. Room overlooked swimming pool in courtyard, and we didn't find it noisy as at the first sign of an over-excited late night (& out-of-pool opening hours anyway) swimmer, the hotel staff quickly dealt with the problem. Room a little dark, as only window was in the door, and we had to keep blinds closed when in room, as other guests pass by on the balcony. Not really a problem, as only slept & changed there. Complimentery breakfast perfectly adequate, though repetitive. We ate in attractive courtyard, though it may be crowded in indoor area if weather was wet. Also, hot drinks available free all day. Staff helpful, chatty and smiling. (trip report will follow in NO forum.)

Reviews.Title: “Classic New Orleans French Quarter - Charm, Hospitality & Location”
Reviews.Author: Tim267
Reviews.Content: Always our choice in the â€˜Quarterâ€™. A lovely hotel with an ideal location that offers easy on-site parking (fee). The pleasant staff provides service with a smile and welcoming words. The beautiful pools and gorgeous fountain courtyard lend to the atmosphere of an authentic French Quarter residence. The enchanting reception room with period furnishings, creates an inviting setting for the continental breakfast each morning. Know that your stay will be truly memorable! We love everything about the Hotel Provincial!! Mary and Tim, Portland, Maine

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: erdawe
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay. We had been here five years ago came back and were not disappointed. Rooms were really nice. Ask for the 500 building and for a balcony. Step out your window onto the balcony overlooking Decatur Street. A table with chairs are on the balcony. So pour yourself an ice cold tasty beverage and sit and enjoy watching all the people go by. Usually can hear music from across the street. Better in the afternoon in the shade. If you need a refrigerator just ask them at the front desk if one is available they will get one for you. I also like that your car is parked in a fairly secure area but easily accessible. We do not go to New Orleans that often but when we do this is the place for us!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: snroberts
Reviews.Content: After doing tons and tons of research, my husband and I settled on the Hotel Provincial for our trip to New Orleans. Boy, are we happy we did! The rooms are very comfortable, the staff exceedingly accommodating and the grounds very well kept. We were there for three nights, and were going to return a few days later. We had reservations at another hotel, but decided to go to back to the Hotel Provincial because of our great experience a few days prior. The location is fantastic...walking distance to basically everything. Right by Jackson Square, Bourbon Street...minutes to pretty much everything else in the Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Authentic rooms with New Orleans hospitality”
Reviews.Author: DWDFtWorth
Reviews.Content: Great rooms. Modern conveniences in an old world setting. If you are tired of the cookie cutter majors, stay here and you will return to the Provincial every chance you get.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy French Quarter hideaway....”
Reviews.Author: PetiteSyrah
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a stay at the Hotel Provincial, and overall, thought it was great! The location is absolutely perfect--between Bourbon and the river, tucked away on a quiet street. The patio and pool are just lovely for relaxing after long, hot days of walking around. The rooms were clean and the A/C was fantastic. The bathrooms really need a makeover, both in size and in modernity, but they were clean and fine for the purpose. My biggest complaint about the rooms is that the courtyard rooms, which don't have a balcony, are VERY loud. The staff does not enforce the alleged quiet hours, and when someone decides to pound on a door at 4am, you'll be awakened. The staff was friendly, if not speedy, and very helpful. Free internet/computer in the lobby was a bonus. We'd absolutely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Did not live up to its potential”
Reviews.Author: FleurdeLisFoodie
Reviews.Content: Pros- Great location in French Quarter near French Market. It was quiet and had some lovely courtyards. The room was clean and beds and plumbing appeared newer. The staff was friendly and it had a nice free continental breakfast. We were able to get complimentary parking with our stay and that saved immensely. There is also a very nice on site restaurant called Stella! Loved the french doors to the room. Cons- The deluxe queen room we booked was in many ways a huge disappointment. As this was our first stay in NOLA, I was looking forward to a lovely antique room. In reality, it appeared that the furniture was dilapidated and the room was dark with a poorly laid out floorplan for the bathroom. The bedframe was metal and appeared to be from the 1970's with some tarnishing/rusting of the copper. The spread was simply unattractive. The nightstand next to the bed had a broken drawer and the wallpaper was peeling. The dresser had one edge being lofted with a small folded stack of papers to keep it from tilting. The bathroom was very narrow and the toilet seat was in need of replacing. Overall, it was a good deal for the price, but it was not the fantasy of an adorable French Quarter historic hotel. Would likely stay somewhere in the west French Quarter near edge of the Warehouse district next time as there were many modern, attractive hotels there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hostoric character”
Reviews.Author: NausicaaNL
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a conference, and thouroughly enjoyed our stay. Our rooms were in the main building which was a nice historical French Quarter building with patio's (one with pool). My room was nice, spacious enough (though not huge) and clean. Also, the airconditioning worked fine,which was a relief as it was pretty warm and humid. I did not have any plumbing problems as has been mentioned here, just had to wait a bit longer for the hot water sometimes. The service at the front desk was ok, although not always fast, but that appears to be the New Orleans way, as we experienced this everywhere we went. Breakfast is simple but sufficient, and of good quality. The internet connection was good, they have several networks, you just have to figure out which was is stongest in your room. The pool is very nice, but not very large. It was fine when we were there, but I can imagine that it may get quite crowded during high season. However, it works fine to cool off, and you don't go to NO to train for the olympics anyway.... On the negative side, there are just two points. First, the hotel does not have a bar, so for drinks you have to rely on vending machines which only serve sodas (no OJ, beer etc) and for snacks you have to go outside. No problem during the day, but after seven it may get hard to find a place to get these things (to take home that is, there are plenty of bars around if you want to go out). Second, the rooms are quite noisy. We had rooms above the restaurant, where they is a constant howl from the vent as well as the live music, and rooms around the patio, which can be noisy if you have bad luck with your co-guests. It was not a big problem when we were there, but again, during busy weekends you may be better of in one of the side buildings. All in all, very nice hotel at a good location. Not fice stars, but more friendly and defenitely good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans style at its best”
Reviews.Author: bajabeach5
Reviews.Content: We had planned on only 4 nights however the stay was so pleasant we booked another night. The staff was charming and so helpful we felt like family. The room had all you want for a stay in New Orleans with very modern amenities like flat screen HD TV and wifi. I would recommend the hotel to business associates as well as friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in French Quarter!”
Reviews.Author: SNPChicago_Il
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel with all the feel that the French Quarter should be. Staff was pleasant, helpful, and were able to take care of any needs or questions we had. Close to everything but quiet and relaxing. We would absolutely stay here again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “It was fine, but there are better options”
Reviews.Author: Mr. Paul Kemp
Reviews.Content: This hotel is getting a little outdated from what I'm sure is heavy use. The buildings themselves have a musty smell that might be 'quaint' in the countryside. Staff is friendly enough, rooms are out-dated and starting to get shabby, although were very clean at least. A common complaint at the hotel is the shower's inability to stick with a temperature. It does the scalding hot to freezing cold for no particular reason thing. When you mention it to the staff they kind of shrug and blame it on the fact that the building is old. The location is great, right between bourbon street and the water, so that's a definite plus.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay--excellent staff.”
Reviews.Author: alohanv
Reviews.Content: My husband & I really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The staff was wonderful and friendly! We checked in a bit early, so our room was not ready. We decided to walk to the French Market while the room was ready. The front desk staff called my cell to notify us that our room was ready. We really liked that. The room was wonderfully furnished with period furniture. We had a balcony so that was especially nice. Kudos to the wonderful staff--they were very helpful and friendlly unlike another hotel we stayed at the night before. I greatly recommend this hotel. My husband & I will definitely stay here again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff, Electrician Necessary”
Reviews.Author: ashleyh962
Reviews.Content: Arrived 5 hours prior to check in. They were kind enough to let us park and return later for check in. Terry was a really great valet guy, very helpful. Nice continental breakfast in the morning, the usual fare. Coffee 24 hours in the lobby, nice pool. Car was parked right next to hotel for easy access. Rooms were very large, most comfortable bed ever. Only issue was when drying hair and iron were one power was knocked out twice. Once was on a Friday night with minimal staff. We had to get ready in the dark until someone (friendly Terry) could flip the breaker. This is an old hotel so this could be expected. Late check out of noon was great, and they kept the car for an extra few hours. Free internet, but could be spotty. Sometimes I could get a wifi connection, sometimes no. Close enough to Bourbon and Jackson square, 3-5 minute walk, but far enough it wasn't loud at night. Would stay again, loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service, bad plumbing”
Reviews.Author: clemitorclover
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a good location, but that's about all I can say for it. The decor was outdated and just not kept up well, chips and frayed carpets everywhere. The plumbing was iffy at best. Maids were very pleasant, but the man at the front desk and the valet were very unpleasant on the several occasions our company had contact. I would definitely not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & amenities.”
Reviews.Author: gr8wanderingypsy
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the ground floor near the courtyard. It was a beautifully decorated room with a half-canopy over the bed & antique furnishings as well as modern amenities including a big hd wall mounted tv that had more channels than I've seen at a hotel, hair dryer & iron with ironing board, There was ample closet space and new & clean linens on the bed (we all know to take off the cover by now right?)with a very comfy mattress, and extra towels in the closet. What I loved most about the romm was if you opened the transfer (old-time window above your door used as air conditioner back in the day) at night, you could hear the water fountain in the courtyard or you could open your shuttered double French doors for some night air and ambiance. We were there the first week of March, so it was very quiet and I never saw many guests except at morning coffee in the lobby. GREAT coffee btw. Walking through the gas lit courtyard at night was like stepping back in time. This is a beautiful hotel except for a couple of things. When they modernized the hotel & put in restrooms, they skimped a bit-well, more than a bit. They put in toilets that belong more in a gas station rest room than a fine hotel room-which this would have been but for the bathroom. Think flushing with your foot & you'll know what I mean. Then there's the water heater situation...I'm not sure what was going on, but every couple of minutes the temperature would change in my shower. I'd either get a blast of freezing water, or scalding water. Other small upgrades need to be done like the antique light/fan dial thingy in the bathroom. I thought it was for your typiical heat lamp, but it wasn't..still not sure & forgot to ask. The lino & carpet could do with updating too, but it was average. The bathroom was disappointing because I loved this hotel & all the other modern amenities are perfect, I'm not sure what happened. Otherwise this hotel was in an awesome location with everything we wanted- good price, free internet, free cont. breakfast, quaint old building, pool, big tv, quiet, and location, location, location. I wish we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “great location but a little unkept”
Reviews.Author: NinaConnecticut
Reviews.Content: The location is wonderful the staff is very nice but the building is tired and a little unkept.we had to ask for toilet paper and we had the suite! it needs a lot of upgrades, the furniture is tired and worn, It just seemed a little dirty.Stella, the restaurant there is TOP NOTCH.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely people, great location!”
Reviews.Author: SanAntonioJane
Reviews.Content: The hotel was staffed with simply lovely people, from valet parking to the front desk. Every encounter we had with the staff was excellent. You really feel like they want to welcome you and they hope you have a good time. Our room was tiny and cramped with an uncomfortable bed, so we upgraded to a great room in a better location, for only a minimal price. It might be worth it to call ahead and get what you want, i.e., the rooms on the internet are NOT what the regular rooms look like! They have a great continental breakfast; wonderful pastries and good coffee. The location? Two blocks off Bourbon Street = close, but quiet. Excellent location! We were there for Mardi Gras, and the last night, we did have some noise problems with the kids next door, but hotel management took care of it.

Reviews.Title: “Would not go back!”
Reviews.Author: PamelaLM
Reviews.Content: Room one had a roach with wings crawling on my floor!!!!!!!!!! I called the front desk and a women shows up with a can of bug spray telling me she is scared of roaches as well and starts screaming. Then some random guy shows up and finally kills the bug. The second room was on the second floor and there was someone else's hair on my pillow. The rooms are small and all are surrounding a parking lot. The staff was not the best and seemed very uninterested in service. My husband and got out of there a day early and would never, never, never go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay, right in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: worktravel007
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel. Staff was generally very courteous, provided nice security during Mardi Gras, and coffee was almost always available in the lobby (it was cold outside!). The room beds were doubles, not the newest mattresses, but clean and service was very prompt for extra towels and blankets. The bathroom hot water wasn't perfect and would scald if not careful. Old hotel with lots of character, although we didn't encounter any ghosts. Hotel has parking which is great to have in this tight area.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fantastic but an enjoyable stay and superb location!”
Reviews.Author: NJ26
Reviews.Content: You really cannot ask for a better location when looking for a hotel in New Orleans, the Provincial is slap bang in the middle of the French Quarter. But you're safe from the noise of Bourbon as the hotel is a good three or four blocks away in a much quieter area. The hotel itself - the website is a bit misleading because it only shows pictures of the rooms clustered around the pool area. There is actually another bigger building at the back. Nothing especially wrong with this - the room was fine, comfortable beds and clean, but make sure you check before arriving if you want to stay in a room by the pool. Breakfast again is nothing special, just a muffin, pastry and coffee but suited us fine. The hotel, while not especially luxurious, fits in the with the French Quarter style and you really do feel like you're in the middle of the Big Easy as opposed to a big souless, hotel chain where you could be anywhere in the world! Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, but probably won't stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: MyDime
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is primo for walking to whereever you want in the Quarters. The setting is beautiful. Gorgeous Courtyard. I feared there would be a lot of waterbugs/palmetto bugs with all the water and vegetation, but I didn't see a single one. The staff is very attentive and nice. The breakfast was skimpy though- coffee, tea, OJ, pastries, apples, and hard boiled eggs. Rooms are hit or miss. The first night we were in a corner room right on the street and that was horrible. I have a phobia that prevents me from sleeping on the first floor, so they moved us to a gorgeous suite in the 400 building the next day. The walls are ridiculously thin, but the noise from the heating and the tv drowned most of it out. My friend found a nail clipping in her bathroom upon chekcing in. And her room was above the restaurant so she heard the piano until closing, which could be good or bad. I got a great deal from Orbitz, but probably will not opt to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, charming ,and affordable hotel in French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: BingTraveler
Reviews.Content: As others have noted the location is great. the hotel is in a quiet part of the french quarter, yet within 2 blocks of Bourbon Street, 1 from the French Market and 4 blocks of Jackson Square. ( We stayed in January during a freakish cold spell so the streets may have been unusually quiet.) The staff is very friendly and attentive.The hotel is not fancy but has a feel of elegance about it, and has a historic feel. The continental breakfasts are rather skimpy and the parking is expensive.. but if you really don't need a car to get to the almost anything, and there are places within a few blocks for a full breakfast .. or you can amble to Cafe du Monde for coffee and beignets.. The restaurant that is attached to the hotel (Stella's) was too pricey for us, but Irene's around the corner is fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: gravedigger_1
Reviews.Content: Very convinient to Decatur, French Market, Cafe Du Monde, Jackson Square and Bourbon. Got a great deal though Travelocity that included free valet parking during our stay and anyone who has visited the quarter knows what a bargin that is.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further”
Reviews.Author: auscarrick47
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel and I cannot speak highly enough of this hotel and it's staff, the hotal is situated a 5 minute walk from Bourbon Street yet is very quite when it is time to get away from the noise, the room we had was very clean and comfortable, the staff were top class when it came to customer service showed a good example of Southern Hospitality, Just prior to leaving New Orleans I left my camera in a shop in town and the staff arranged for my camera to be picked up from the shop and posted to Australia. If you would like to get the feel of New Orleans look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Very Positive Experience at the Hotel Provincial”
Reviews.Author: Bill G
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for four nights over the Thanksgiving holidays. I had been reading mixed reviews about the hotel on Tripadvisor. Our experience was great. We had a ground floor room next the the pool. The room was clean and there wasn't any noise to deal with because of the cool weather and no one using the pool. The staff was very nice to us during our entire stay. The rooms are sufficient in size, but, not over large or small. The hotel parking is on site with quick service getting your car. We had a good wifi signal in our room and it is free. We also were able to get free parking by just asking.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: docmjc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a special event on Bourbon street. The hotel is just enough off Bourbon street to be away from the flash and glitter when you need a break or when you want to sleep. The hotel itself is darling. We got a room overlooking the pool on the second floor and loved it. The pool courtyard is simply beautiful with the antique green pool surrounded by red brickwork decking and walls. There are numerous courtyards in the hotel and it is lovely to walk around exploring them to find a peaceful spot by one of the fountains in one of the courtyard gardens. The hotel is pretty secure. The Lobby door is locked late at night and entry is through the locked security gate with presentation of the room key for ID. The hotel is close enough to everything to walk everywhere, not only on bourbon street but also close to Decatur with all of its shops and restaurants, Jackson park wtih its artists and performers, and the riverfront. We booked through travelocity and we were very happy with the rate we got. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great position”
Reviews.Author: Daisychain33
Reviews.Content: We were able to walk everywhere which was great as we were travelling with my daughter who is 6 month pregnant and her partner. They do have smokers rooms which are very smelly. We had two rooms overlooking the road which is very noisy with garbage trucks etc but they were well well appointed. Try to get a room overlooking the courtyard or pool. Lots of retirees who get a special rate. Breakfast ordinary, danish pastries, cold boiled eggs, floury apples, orange juice, tea and coffee but would go back again becasue of position.

Reviews.Title: “Charming room, but old plumbing”
Reviews.Author: GlacierGirl2009
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and several friends visited New Orleans for a family wedding recently. Several of us stayed at the Provincial in a wide assortment of rooms. Ours was a beautifully appointed delux queen with 12 foot ceilings, a fireplace, a gigantic antique bed and armoire and lots of charm. The wide screen television and free high speed internet were a great amenity to have, as was the coffee, tea, and assorted baked goods each morning down in the lobby. The courtyards are nice, too, especially with the wonderful November weather we enjoyed down there, but I wouldn't swim in either of the pools on a bet. The bathroom was probably the only real minus, as the venting in this old building is, well, old, and the shower didn't drain until well after the shower was completed, plus it wasn't terribly clean. Our friends and others in our group had rooms which ranged from dark, damp and cramped to a lovely, bright condo overlooking a beautiful courtyard and garden. One family changed rooms after the first day because they were so disappointed with the room. It seemed that the biggest gripe everyone had was about the bathrooms, general cleanliness and the damp smell. The staff was nice, the location good and rates quite reasonable. Plus, you could print your boarding pass using a convenient computer/printer in the lobby. I don't think we'd stay there again, however, as there are too many other options available.

Reviews.Title: “A little tattered, but still the best location in the Quarter"”
Reviews.Author: badpatti
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Provincial whenever we've been in NOLA since the mid-eighties. While it's never been snazzy, it's location can't be beat -- well away from Canal Street, three easy blocks to the Cafe du Monde, within walking distance of everything in the Vieux Carre. The rates are reasonable and the hotel has it's own parking lot -- no waiting for a valet. The rooms aren't plush but they're comfortable and quiet. This building has been around since before the Civil War, and some things about that show, but if you don't insist on perfection, it's a fine place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: yvoila
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel right in the French Quarter with parking which was great. Very convenient location to pretty much all of the French Quarter. Beautiful buildings with lovely courtyard and pool. Our room was spacious, nicely decorated and clean with a Juliet balcony looking out on to the street. There's a great restaurant around the corner called Irene's where we went one night when there was really heavy rain.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: vcjncal
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel in a great location. I am a full time student who visited during my spring break with limited funds and found the hotel to be very accommodating to my budget, and provided the experiences I wanted to enjoy while visiting New Orleans. The staff was friendly and extremely helpful. Close enough to Bourbon Street to walk but far enough to avoid too much noise. I had a great time and will be booking a stay there again and without reservation recommend it to anyone who will be visiting the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet in the French Quarter . . but that's all”
Reviews.Author: botanicalwoman
Reviews.Content: Booked a "Deluxe Double" with 2 queen beds. On check-in, the valet walked us out to the parking court and pointed to the building which held our room--no offer to show us to it, no offer to carry our bags. The room numbering system is a bit peculiar--533 is on the third floor in building 5, which we found because we ran into other guests, not because of any information from the staff. Room was small and a bit worn, but clean and quiet. During a four-night stay, maid service appeared only once, so beds were un-made and supplies not replenished. AC stopped working during the last night of our stay--fortunately it was cool in NO that night. Stella! restaurant is on premises.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: babblingbrook78
Reviews.Content: We were looking for an atmospheric hotel and a good deal. We found both with Hotel Provincial. A positively gorgeous hotel, helpful staff, and a decent and clean room. The location was perfect, so close to the French Market, mere blocks from the Blacksmith Shop. Incidentally, if anyone staying in room 107 found 2 sd cards in a ziploc bag, I'd love to have them back!

Reviews.Title: “Was not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: MazelandPoncho
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Provincial for 2 nights. The hotel complex includes 5 buildings and is within walking distance to just about anything in the French Quarter, which was great. That said, we were very disappointed in the room. We paid for a premium room, which we were told meant that our window would face the courtyard or pool area. Instead, our room was in the building furthest from the main building, the room and bathroom seemed shabby, rather than just dated, and our only window faced the street. No big deal, but we were charged for a premium room. When we questioned the view, we were told that a premium room also included looking out at the street, so we just accepted rather than argue. Thing is, the room was so small that the space between the window and the bed was about one-half foot. You really couldn't look out the window without standing on the bed. Also, because the streets are so narrow, all we could see was the trees that lined the street. If you wanted to look at the street you had to put your head against the window and look down. Also, when the air conditioner was running, it was very loud and about 30 seconds after it shut off, there was a very, very loud noise - needless to say, I didn't get a good night's sleep. The room was overrated, and If you book a room there, don't bother to pay for a premium room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place In The Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Misss_Tish
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough good things about the Provincial-- great location, close enough to be in action, but quiet enough to get a good night's sleep. Our room was by the front courtyard, allowing easy access to the front desk-- who were more than helpful with food and sightseeing recommendations! The free coffee, tea, and contential breakfast was a lovely perk, not to mention the coffee is actually the good stuff! It was fun to watch the "Haunted New Orleans" tours stop by the front of the hotel to take pictures-- I did not get any type of "eerie" feeling while we were there. When we return to this wonderful and beautiful city, we will be staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Haunted!”
Reviews.Author: burbmama
Reviews.Content: Yes,its true.Very haunted.We stayed in the outer building.I asked to be located in the less haunted section,but apparently got the opposite.Turns out it's on the ghost tours,and for good reason.Lots of dense energy,probably due to the fact that it was a civil war hospital.Lots of electrical phenomema.Tricks with the water,etc.If you are entertained by this,its worth the stay. Other than that,great location,clean and quiet,nice staff,too.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant suprise”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkJameson
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel due to the fact we couldn't get rooms in the place we normally stay. The hotel is close enough but far enough away from the bars on Bourbon Street. Cafe DuMonde is three blocks away. The service and the rooms were excellent. Needless to say we will not be going back to the other hotel as the Provincial was just much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Poopie
Reviews.Content: Rooms were great, people were great, location great. Can't say enough good things about this place. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base.”
Reviews.Author: TravellingManGD
Reviews.Content: This is a great little-known hotel just a few blocks from Bourbon Street and from the Mississippi. The room was spacious and very comfortable and the staff were always ready to help or give advice. The several little courtyards were possibly just in need of some tidying up but thats the only complaint. Considering its so close to the action, it is very peaceful there at night

Reviews.Title: “peaceful and relaxing but still in the heart of the quarter”
Reviews.Author: RalphLee
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Provincial was very pleasant. My room was spacious and comfortable, the surrounding courtyards are tranquil and an oasis away from the busy french quarter, yet you are still in a very central location. The staff are also very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “This is the way I'd always pictured the French Quarter....”
Reviews.Author: BEIGNETBABY
Reviews.Content: This historic hotel is dripping with old New Orleans charm and I would stay here again. Valet parking is on site, which I appreciated, as I didn't have to worry about the location of my car. The original room we were given had a balcony, with a floor to ceiling window for access, which was very cool, however, the room had a horrible moldy odor that the air conditioner just couldn't overcome. After two nights of sleeping with my head under the sheet so I couldn't smell that odor, I spoke with some of the other guests and found that none of them had a complaint. I asked at the front desk for a different room, explaining the problem, and they were very curtious and offered us a choice of two different rooms. We moved within 20 minutes and were extremely happy that we did. Although the second room didn't have the balcony, it had a ceiling fan (wonderful) and a small courtyard with a table and chairs. The staff was friendly and helpful, with a great knowledge of the restaurants and local activities...I loved them. If you go, be sure to compare prices on the bus tours and with a GPS, it's an easy drive to some of the plantations. Admission is about $15, while a bus tour is about $50. Be sure to go to Willie Mae's Scotch House for lunch...the best fried chicken in the world! P

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Quiet..”
Reviews.Author: brxgrl19
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at this hotel! Check in was a breeze, Friendly staff, and friendly ghost :-) The room was nice and spacious, clean, and quiet, even though we were right in front of the courtyard. Beautiful setting. Great location, just a few blocks from rowdy Bourbon Street. Safe neighborhood. I would definitely stay here again. Only this time i would try and book the supposedly haunted building 5.

Reviews.Title: “Another nice stay at the Provincial”
Reviews.Author: Hestia_55
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd stay at the Provincial and it did not disappoint. We are spoiled by the convenient location, just a few blocks from most places you want to go in the Quarter. In the heat, it is very nice to be able to go back to the room and freshen up without hiking too far. The parking lot in the middle of the property is another convenience. We stayed in the Petite Suite this time and it slept the 5 of us quite comfy. The staff is nice and helpful. They came pretty quickly to bring us more towels when we returned to our room after 11:00 pm.

Reviews.Title: “Nice pool & courtyard & in French Quarter but rooms a bit 'tired'.”
Reviews.Author: DELTAK
Reviews.Content: We have visited New Orleans 13 times over the past 20 years and last stayed at The Provincial about 10 years ago.we had considered staying there again in 2007 but our tour advisor said there had been some security problems so we stayed elsewhere. This time we decided to take a chance and book The Provincial.Our room was in the main building,was a reasonable size but the decor was a bit 'tired' - but the pool and courtyard areas were very good.Our main problem with the room was that in looked out onto Chartres Street and suffered from traffic noise late at night and early mornings. Unlike a previous complaint the air con worked ok in our room. Initially disappointed that there was no longer any hotel breakfast restaurant but the free continental breakfast made up for this. Our main disappointment was not the hotel but the fact that,outside of the Jazz Fest dates,there is very little live jazz to be found - apart from the excellent Palm Court Restaurant/Nightclub on Decatur. Also a combination of Katrina & recession seems to have hit New Orleans badly with closing some of our favourite eateries closing, many shops missing from River Walk Shopping Mall and the demise of the main music stores.

Reviews.Title: “History, atmosphere but -”
Reviews.Author: Rt66tbird
Reviews.Content: Most reviews cover the pros and cons pretty well. I like the atmosphere. It is close to the French Market. Dining etc in the area is varied and you can do pretty well. The levee street car is close. The rooms to the rear of the property are serviced by an elevator. Rooms really need updating. At least with furnishings that are not so worn. I enjoyed my stay but the Provincial would not be my first pick in the Quarter. Courtyard behind the office is nice. My key comment however is: What A Great Staff.

Reviews.Title: “Was a little disappointed”
Reviews.Author: nawlins95
Reviews.Content: I am an avid New Orleans traveler - have been there 50+ times. We have stayed at probably just as many hotels and B & Bs in the town as well. After reading these reviews I was very excited to stay there for Jazz Fest. But I have to say I was a little disappointed. There were some positivies - good service, beautiful grounds (pools, courtyard) and in a great neighboorhood where you were close enough to the action but a little quieter for relaxing at the end of the day. But the rooms are nothing to write home about. Maybe it's because I have stayed at so many places and have many to compare this to. But the room looked a little run down, even a little dirty and so were the hallways, elevator, etc. I stayed in building 5, 4th floor. Bed wasn't very comfortable. So for $229 a night I didn't think it was worth the money. Maybe $149/night.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here for Jazz Fest”
Reviews.Author: WorkingMomChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel three times and I love it: great location, good service, historically decorated room and beautiful courtyard. I have always stayed in the front part of the hotel, with either a courtyard or poolside room - it is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but rooms are dated”
Reviews.Author: kiwizoe
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Provicial for 2 nights since he had a 3 day business meeting at this hotel. We were in building 5 and there was an elevator that we never had to wait for. The room was small and needed updating. Bathroom sink water was not always hot and the shower had a hard time regulating the temperature. The bathroon sink clogged on the first day we were there. Carpet was ripped in several spots and the flat screen tv very small. The room itself was clean but very noisy (toiled made noises all night and the fuse box in the closet was loud) There was alot of music from the French Market right outside and people on the streets. The location is great, right in the French Quarter and an easy walk to Riverwalk for shopping. The staff is very friendly and pleasant. Courtyards and pools are beautiful and well maintained. Continental breakfast that included pastries, muffins and apples. Coffee and hot tea available at all times. We skipped the breakfast and walked the 2 blocks to Cafe DuMond for hot beignets. We would not stay here again just due to the fact that we did not like the rooms. I had requested a king bed several times and while the hotel seemed empty our request was not honored. The double beds were very uncomfortable. Price was reasonable at $129.00 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, value & full of charm”
Reviews.Author: Smartlitter
Reviews.Content: My husband & I have stayed here 4 times and each time is more satisfying. The location is perfect, within walking distance of all the French Quarter must-do's but far enough away to be comfortably quiet. Charming courtyards, pools, fountains, genuine historic buildings with unique rooms, some small. But NO ELEVATORS, so request a ground floor room if that's a problem. Friendly and helpful staff. Last visit we had 9 suitcases and 2nd floor rooms (2 couples before a cruise) - the Bellman didn't even flinch. And it's within a block of Irene's - our favorite restaurant (so far) in NOLA. Yum! The restaurant 'Stella' is located in the hotel's parking lot and is very good but really pricey. While you're in NOLA book a tour with Bloody Mary. The best of all the ghost tours we've taken there. She's one of a kind!

Reviews.Title: “great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: wormula
Reviews.Content: Hotel Provincial has a wonderful location in the French Quarter on the side closest to the French Market. We enjoyed our stay. The room was clean, roomy enough for 4 people and the staff was really helpful/friendly. The only negatives are that the room has no mini-fridge or microwave which would have been really helpful. The hotel was a good value for us only because we recieved a discount since we were volunteering for Habitat for Humanity. Hotel offers parking for 21$ per day which was not in our budget. We had no trouble finding on-street parking after 6pm (we didnt look before then since we were gone all day).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location But Beware”
Reviews.Author: goin2skool
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Provincial proved to be quite disappointing. While the location is ideal, the staff was less than friendly. Although I was specifically told that my card would be held and not charged until checkout, that was a lie. Since I was splitting the room with someone else, I was told I would have to wait 4-5 days to get the money back while my card was over drafted and I was unable to use it for the remainder of my stay. The staff did not seem to care about this and was not particularly helpful. Also, for each night you stay at the hotel, they will bill you for parking and it is rather expensive. Even with this high cost of parking, the valet was less than friendly. The rooms are charming yet small, while the bathrooms could use an update. It is however, located between Bourbon and the French Market district and most everything we wanted was in walking distance. Next time, I will sacrifice my location for a friendlier manager and more straightforward billing.

Reviews.Title: “Week-day? Yes, Week-end? No”
Reviews.Author: mfl243
Reviews.Content: The Provincial has good & bad. Good: quiet location in Vieux Carre, close to Jackson Square, great restaurants a block or two away, Community Coffee around the corner, loads of charm and style. The bad: inattentive service (we had no maid service the first day, called the front desk to report this and got a 'so, what do you want me to do about it? response), dated, cheaply done bathroom, some beat up antiques in the room. It all tips on money, the weekday rate of $150 doubled to $310 Friday & Saturday nights. For $150 it charms, for $310 the flaws begin to show.

Reviews.Title: “Needs updating.”
Reviews.Author: Larry1962
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong, I love this hotel and will keep coming back, but the room that we stayed in off the main courtyard needed some updating other than the flat screen TV. First of all, we didn't sleep well in the mornings due to rude people who, after getting their free breakfast, congregated in the courtyard moving around the heavy wrought iron chairs and talking loudly. Not the hotels' fault, but still we couldn't sleep past 7am. The room smelled strange, like a pepper spray smell...we had to get some incense from the voodoo store to mask the smell. Also, the bathroom was in major need of attention. It was no better than a cheap interstate motel bathroom. The exhaust fan was as loud as a lawnmower (I kid you not) and the tub was stained with cigarette burns.
