These include â€œsuitesâ€� consisting of bizarre loft and windowless lower room combinations, replete with dirt and careworn dÃ©cor; bathroom mirrors so low you need to kneel to see your reflection; desk clerks who have obviously fired the sunset gun in the early afternoon; grisly legends of leather-clad physician ghosts wielding saws; and a general air of decay and neglect. The prices at the Provincial are higher than 5 star hotels in the same neighborhood â€“ they obviously want to sting you for a rate that would equal 5 nights rent at a fair market rate, because nobody will stay a 2nd night in this place. The best indicator of neglect was on a small plaque outside the building â€“ barely noticeable, indicating that the Provincial had been awarded a local prize for tasteful renovation in 1961!

Reviews.Title: “great location in the quarter- close to everything and away from all the noise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I love that is it in the quarter and walking distance from everything. I really love that it is not in the center of the quarter so you dont have to put up with the noise of all the drunks..the rooms are beautifull and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Character is good.”
Reviews.Author: cathyHuntsville_AL
Reviews.Content: personally, i loved the hotel provincial. we did stay in the back building, #5 and though it had it's faults, i found it charming. my spouse on the other hand, found it dingy and stale. i think he's a snob. ok, when the toilet flushed in the next room, the shower went freezing. that was wierd. -but with 15-foot ceilings, chandeliers and an enormous balcony overlooking the french market, i can deal with a few faults. i like to call it "character." it sure beats your usual cookie-cutter McHotels!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, especially for Cafe du Monde”
Reviews.Author: giltex
Reviews.Content: Wife and I just returned from NO, a little trip to celebrate our 40th anniversary. Stayed two nights in the Provincial, building 5. Contrary to some postings we were very pleased with the hotel and the assigned room. We like to stay in the older, historic hotels with the 12 foot ceilings, mismatched, but almost antique furniture, oak doors and trim, and the creakiness of the stairways. The room & bath were clean and the ac was running full blast on 70 when we checked in. Walking out the "front door" through the bar put us in the middle of the French market on Decatur St and just a short walk through the market to the Moon Walk, the levy walk on the Mississippi. Leave by the front door of the hotel on Chartres, turn left and it's just two blocks to Jackson Square. We'll stay here next time!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience”
Reviews.Author: Duckscribe
Reviews.Content: I spent five nights at the Hotel Provincial in February 2004. It was a positive experience and I'd stay there again. The location is very good: close to everything, but on a quiet street. My experience was enhanced by being assigned to perhaps the best room in the place: one of the rooms overlooking the street with its own private balcony. I was put there after my assigned room turned up dirty when I arrived. It isn't the most modern hotel, so it's not good for travelers who expect all the modern conveniences (convenient internet connections, honor bar, business center, etc.) It has off-street parking, which is big plus if you have a car.

Reviews.Title: “So many better hotels in area”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the back building which was so stale and musty, we had to buy candles to get through the night. Shabby and totally unacceptable considering how many other hotels for roughly the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful and full of character”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a sterile, cookie-cutter hotel, this one is not for you. However, if you're looking for some real French Quarter character, this is a great place. It is in a quiet area of the French Quarter, but still just steps away from everything, including the Ursulines stop on the riverfront trolley. I agree with some earlier comments about building 5 - definitely shabby with views overlooking the parking lot - though I believe it is the only one with an elevator. We made a point of requesting "anything but 5" and we got a charming room overlooking the Old Ursuline Convent. The hotel has two small pools and several charming courtyards - delightful respites from the pounding summer heat. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, shame about the bar!”
Reviews.Author: DaveWBromborough
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Very helpful at reception, but they need to get a new barman in the Honfleur Bar. He was ignorant and too busy flirting with two young ladies to bother serving us. Rooms clean, service great, fantastic location in the heart of the French Quarter, with a feeling of security.

Reviews.Title: “Room Assignment Makes All the Difference”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Provinical in late March 2004. We booked via Hotels.com for a total of $149 including taxes. Our initial room was horrible--it was dank, claustrophic and stained--it's in the multi-story building overlooking the parking lot. After repeated requests, we were moved to a lovely, albeit smoking, room overlooking the pool. We greatly enjoyed the nearby courtyard and spent most of our time there. Management informed us that booking via the web will always land you in the multi-story building so bear that in mind.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed two nights here, and we have nothing to complain about. the staff was helpful and courteous, and the room was clean and the location in the french quarter is less than 5 mins walk to Bourbon. Valet parking and delivery was swift. yes, we would stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Charming, Friendly, Grear deal, Great location!”
Reviews.Author: karilc
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice, once in November for an academic conference, and once during the Christmas holiday season and have stayed in 3 different rooms in three different buildings. Both trips we received an unbelievably low rate ($69/$59) per night!!!! and were treated like welcomed friends! The staff was amazing, courteous, efficient, and friendly. This was consistent on both trips! The hotel is comprised of several buildings surrounding a center parking lot (great if you're driving to New Orleans where it is impossible to park) each building is charming in it's own right, unique --- with twists and turns and hidden courtyards! At night the place is especially magical with illuminated pools (2) several fountains and gas lamps! This is the true New Orleans, and the property has an authentic, old style charm and so you will not find it to be "disney-esque" (it really is old, not just made to "feel" old) or sterile. Yes, there is moss growing on the brick here and there, and it's utterly charming! You won't find the sterile immaculate opulance of an expensive, overpriced and (frankly --boring (yawn!) upscale hotel that could be literally ANY city or any country in the world. If you like cookie cutter "upscale" properties -- that no matter how "grand" all seem exactly the same --- those ubiquitous pianos in the lobby--- and polished elevator doors, this is not for you. In fact, there are no elevators. If you stay at the Provincial, you will KNOW you are traveling in New Orleans and no place else! It's truly charming. Entrances on both Chartres street (front entrance) and Decatur (back entrance) -- this is a PERFECT location in the French Quarter. It is in a very quiet section, yet just blocks from all the action and nearby attractions. The quiet is all the more appreciated because you can hear quite regularly the clip clop of the tourist buggies and horse (mule) drawn carriages. While the entire property is quiet once inside, the Decatur street entrance is busier and bustling at night, ever so slightly in an 'off-beat' way...and the front entrance is very quiet and residential. Both have security past 10/11 pm and require a room key to pass security guards and/or locked doors/gates. The small and very friendly Honfluer Bar is part of the property, and looks out on busy Decatur Street -- was recently remodeled in December 04. We did not eat at Stella (onsite restaurant) but it is classy and elegant and gets rave reviews in a very "foodie" town! Will make a third trip for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I come to New Orleans about once a month to stay in the French Quarter and this hotel was a very pleasant surprise! The location was ideal and the staff was very courteous and friendly. I will be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a single woman traveller”
Reviews.Author: LeighBCD
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a week as a lone female traveller and it was wonderful. The location is extremely central and it is possible to walk everywhere in the French Quarter - night and day - and feel safe when doing so. My room was great and looked out onto a courtyard overlooking the fountain. The staff were really friendly. I really liked this hotel and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at several French Quarter hotels (one of them was on Esplanade and really awful). The Provincial was by far the best: the room was attractive and nicely kept, the staff was pleasant and helpful, the location was excellent (in the best part of the Quarter). In addition, there's a wonderful in-house restaurant (Stella) and Cafe Beignet just adjacent. It couldn't be more convenient. Best of all, our room overlooked a beautiful interior courtyard filled with trees and a fountain. We would definitely stay at the Provincial again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from building 5!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Provincial is actually made up of 5 different buildings. We stayed in room 532, which stands for building 5 room 32. Building 5 is quite run down compared to the rest of the hotel. If, while you're checking in, you are informed you will be in building 5, I would recommend that you ask to be moved to another building or find another hotel.The staff are very courtious and friendly. The location is excellent if you are planning on staying in the French Quarter.Their cafe (Cafe Beignet) served mediocre food for breakfast. We only ate there 1 time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect little hotel....”
Reviews.Author: murphysmum
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about this hotel! Room with a view as promised. Walking distance to all of French Quarter, but quiet and charming. Friendly staff. I would definitely stay at the Provincial again!

Reviews.Title: “This is a great place to stay in the French Quarter!”
Reviews.Author: luv2roamLB
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was great! We stayed here for two nights and were so pleased with the rooms for size, cleanliness, and ambiance. Very New Orleans charming. The staff at the front desk were very cordial and customer service oriented. It is very close to everything in the French Quarter and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hit or Miss”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It was our first time to New Orleans, and this hotel was a huge disappointment. Our first room had a huge dead cockroach, our second room hadn't been cleaned, and our third room was pretty dingy. But the hotel staff was very helpful and conciliatory. We ended up switching hotels but the staff was extremely apologetic and definitely tried to make up for it. Based on what others have written, I think you can have a lot of luck here, but we just didn't. If you are staying in the French Quarter, you have to expect that there is character that you wouldn't find at bigger chain hotels. And character isn't always positive.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELBYDEFAULT
Reviews.Content: Please read this review before you make a reservation. I stayed at the Provincial both for Jazz Fest and Halloween weekend. Though I paid the same price for each of my two stays in a one bedroom suite, the difference in the accomodations was shocking. The first visit landed us in a beautiful modern townhouse style suite, followed by a musty, damp and windowless interior unit on the second visit. I was horrified to realize that a hotel would advertise and charge the same for such different rooms. The mirror in the bathroom was positioned so low I had to kneel to comb my hair, and the tub and toilet area reminded me of something only a college student would accept. If you must stay at this hotel, ask to see your room before finalyzing the stay. If not, you may have your whole N.O. experience clouded by disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Dimmetasse
Reviews.Content: I took my mother here for her 70th birthday and the hotel was wonderful. We got great out of season rates in June/July and felt safe because they lock the main gate after 11pm. All arrivals must enter through the lobby. This hotel also has Several courtyards with great "New Orleans" atmosphere! Would stay here everytime I go to New Orleans!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Provincial is Excellent”
Reviews.Author: FriendlyTraveler1
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd stay at Hotel Provincial and I recommend it highly to anyone who is looking for a reasonably priced hotel with excellent location and friendly staff. The rooms in the back portion are particularly nice and quiet (seperate building from the main part of hotel) and very roomy.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed Hotel Provincial!”
Reviews.Author: sancap
Reviews.Content: A group of 9 recently stayed at the Hotel Provincial . Staff was very friendly and answered our questions with a smile. Rooms were comfortable and quiet. We enjoyed the courtyard each evening before and after supper. Please be aware, there are no elevators at the hotel, if this is a problem, as for a room on the ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “just wonderful”
Reviews.Author: oakislander
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked the Provincial after reading reviews on this website. We were not disappointed with a thing! You are greeted warmly upon your arrival; the staff is always helpful with directions, suggestions, and reservations. Our room was charming (and right by the courtyard...each morning i thought it was raining...it was the fountain!); the location of the hotel is perfect. The Provincial is close enough to walk absolutely anywhere, and nestled away enough to be quiet and relaxing. This hotel is worth every penny, and frankly, a great value for the French Quarter. We look forward to going to New Orleans, and the Provincial, again!

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd year to come to NO for a Saints game and it may have been our best. My husband and I came with 3 other couples. All of our rooms were unique and different but were all beautiful. Ours had a balcony overlooking Conti St(i think) and the others each had their own courtyards outside their rooms. The New Orleans charm was wonderful!!! It was the perfect location and staff was informative on where to go. Very romantic hotel and will definately try to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Provincial”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel really added to our anniversary visit and my wife's 1st trip to NO. I asked for a nice room and ended up w/ a Queen suite, for no extra chg. This had 12 ft ceilings, large chandelier over the bed, recentlyrenovated room plus a sitting room, and fluffy feather pillows. The staff was very nice and the location is terrific; on the quieter side of the Quarter but near Jackson Square and 1 blk from French Market. Booked online for $110 or 120. This place felt more like an apartment which is what you want from a boutique hotel in the quarter. Enjoyed NO and my wife will take great memories from both the city and the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 25 years ago and wanted to see it again. The rooms are old, but the charm is there. We had a room that opened up right to a lovely courtyard. The attendants were very polite and helpful. They actually told me that if I could, get a coupon at the rest stop in Louisianna for a coupon. This saved us more than half the rate! We were there mid week and the location is perfect for walking everywhere...I even felt safe there.

Reviews.Title: “Beautful Hotel in the Quarter”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Provincial for Southern Decadence. The hotel is perfectly situated, just two blocks off Bourbon Street and one block from the French Market. The room overlooked the pool and was clean and spacious. The staff were friendly and helpful. We will defintely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Provincial is a treasure”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from a trip to New Orleans to celebrate my 40th B-Day. I chose the Hotel Provincial after a lot of research, including the reviews from this website. We were not disappointed. The location is wonderful, close to the French Market, Cafe DuMonde and the path to Riverwalk right on the Mississippi. It was a great place to come to back to after a day of sightseeing or an evening listening to music (Kermit Ruffins plays at Vaughns Thursday nights and is not to be missed). The large pool and courtyard were beautiful and well maintained, our room was charming and we found the staff to be friendly yet unobtrusive. We would stay here again.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Provincial
HotelInfo.Address: 1024 Rue Chartres, New Orleans, LA 70116
